CURRENT_YEAR_LOW_MARK_PRICE_SETTLEMENT.description: he settlement value, at the point in the current year (excluding the current day) that the mark price is lowest. I.e. for the period running from the 1st of January - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the year. If today is the 1st of January, or there have been no updates in the time period, the CURRENT_YEAR_OPEN_SETTLEMENT will be given. The yearly value will either be this, or the settlement value corresponding to the CURRENT_DAY_LOW_MARK_PRICE - whichever has a lower mark price.

CURRENT_YEAR_LOW_QUOTE.description: The lowest settlement value (in the quote currency) of the current year, excluding the current day. I.e. for the period running from the 1st of January - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the year. If today is the 1st day of January, or there have been no updates in the time period, the CURRENT_YEAR_OPEN_QUOTE value will be given. The yearly value will either be this, or the CURRENT_DAY_LOW_QUOTE value - whichever is lowest.

CURRENT_YEAR_LOW_QUOTE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in the current year (excluding the current day) that the settlement value (in the quote currency) is lowest. I.e. for the period running from the 1st of January - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the year. If today is the 1st of January, or there have been no updates in the time period, the CURRENT_YEAR_OPEN_MARK_PRICE will be given. The yearly value will either be this, or the mark price corresponding to the CURRENT_DAY_LOW_QUOTE - whichever has the lowest associated settlement value.

CURRENT_YEAR_TOTAL_OPEN_INTEREST_UPDATES.description: The total number of updates between 1st of January (xxxx:01:01 00:00:00 GMT/UTC) and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the year. If today is 1st of January, this value will be 0. To get the total yearly value add CURRENT_DAY_TOTAL_OPEN_INTEREST_UPDATES to this value.

CURRENT_YEAR_SETTLEMENT_CHANGE.description: The value change from the current year. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_YEAR_MARK_PRICE_CHANGE.description: The value change from the current year. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_YEAR_QUOTE_CHANGE.description: The value change from the current year. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_YEAR_SETTLEMENT_CHANGE_PERCENTAG.description: The percentage change from the current year. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

CURRENT_YEAR_MARK_PRICE_CHANGE_PERCENTAG.description: The percentage change from the current year. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

CURRENT_YEAR_QUOTE_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the current year. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

MOVING_24_HOUR_OPEN_SETTLEMENT.description: The value of the closest settlement update to the period start date (23 hours + current hour ago). This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full 24 hour value.

MOVING_7_DAY_OPEN_SETTLEMENT.description: The value of the closest settlement update to the period start date. Here, the period is equal to 6 full days, plus the time that has elapsed in the current day. So, the period start date will be (6 days + (xx:xx:xx GMT/UTC current day - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC )) ago. This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full 7 day value.

MOVING_180_DAY_OPEN_QUOTE.description: The value of the closest settlement update (in the quote currency) to the period start date. Here, the period is equal to 179 full days, plus the time that has elapsed in the current day. So, the period start date will be (179 days + (xxxxxx GMT/UTC current day - 000000 GMT/UTC )) ago. This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full 180 day value.

MOVING_180_DAY_HIGH_SETTLEMENT.description: The highest settlement value within the period running from 180 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (179 days in total). The 180 day value will either be this, or the CURRENT_DAY_HIGH_SETTLEMENT value - whichever is higher.

MOVING_180_DAY_HIGH_SETTLEMENT_MARK_PRIC.description: The mark price, at the point during the period that the settlement value is highest. Here, the period runs from 180 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (179 days in total) The 180 day value will either be this, or the CURRENT_DAY_HIGH_SETTLEMENT_MARK_PRICE - whichever has a higher associated settlement.

MOVING_180_DAY_HIGH_MARK_PRICE.description: The highest mark price in the period running from 180 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (179 days in total). The 180 day high value will either be this, or the CURRENT_DAY_HIGH_MARK_PRICE - whichever is higher.

MOVING_180_DAY_HIGH_MARK_PRICE_SETTLEMEN.description: The settlement, at the point in the period that the mark price is highest. Here, the period runs from 180 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (179 days in total). The 180 day value will either be this, or the CURRENT_DAY_HIGH_MARK_PRICE_SETTLEMENT - whichever has a higher associated mark price.

MOVING_180_DAY_HIGH_QUOTE.description: The highest settlement value, given in the quote currency, in the period running from 180 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (179 days in total). The 180 day value will either be this, or the CURRENT_DAY_HIGH_QUOTE - whichever is higher.

MOVING_180_DAY_HIGH_QUOTE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in the period that the settlement (in the quote currency) is highest. Here, the period runs from 180 days ago to the beginning of the current day (179 days in total). The 180 day value will either be this, or the CURRENT_DAY_HIGH_QUOTE_MARK_PRICE - whichever has the higher associated settlement value.

MOVING_180_DAY_LOW_SETTLEMENT.description: The lowest settlement value in the period running from 180 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (179 days in total). The 180 day value will either be this, or the CURRENT_DAY_LOWER_SETTLEMENT - whichever is lower.

MOVING_180_DAY_LOW_SETTLEMENT_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point during the period that the settlement value is lowest. Here, the period runs from 180 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (179 days in total) The 180 day value will either be this, or the CURRENT_DAY_LOW_SETTLEMENT_MARK_PRICE - whichever has a lower associated settlement.

MOVING_180_DAY_LOW_MARK_PRICE.description: The lowest mark price in the period running from 180 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (179 days in total). The 180 day low value will either be this, or the CURRENT_DAY_LOW_MARK_PRICE - whichever is lower.

MOVING_180_DAY_LOW_MARK_PRICE_SETTLEMENT.description: The settlement, at the point in the period that the mark price is lowest. MOVING_180_DAY_LOW_QUOTE.description: The lowest settlement value, given in the quote currency, in the period running from 180 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (179 days in total). The 180 day value will either be this, or the CURRENT_DAY_LOW_QUOTE - whichever is lower.

MOVING_180_DAY_LOW_QUOTE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in the period that the settlement (in the quote currency) is lowest. Here, the period runs from 180 days ago to the beginning of the current day (179 days in total). The 180 day value will either be this, or the CURRENT_DAY_LOW_QUOTE_MARK_PRICE - whichever has a lower associated settlement value.

MOVING_180_DAY_TOTAL_OPEN_INTEREST_UPDAT.description: The total number of updates between 180 days ago and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day (179 days in total). To get the total 180 day value add CURRENT_DAY_TOTAL_OPEN_INTEREST_UPDATES to this value.

MOVING_180_DAY_SETTLEMENT_CHANGE.description: The value change from the MOVING_180_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

MOVING_180_DAY_MARK_PRICE_CHANGE.description: The value change from the MOVING_180_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

MOVING_180_DAY_QUOTE_CHANGE.description: The value change from the MOVING_180_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

MOVING_180_DAY_SETTLEMENT_CHANGE_PERCENT.description: The percentage change from the MOVING_180_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

MOVING_180_DAY_MARK_PRICE_CHANGE_PERCENT.description: The percentage change from the MOVING_180_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

MOVING_180_DAY_QUOTE_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the MOVING_180_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

LIFETIME_FIRST_UPDATE_TS.description: The timestamp of the first update of the instrument.

LIFETIME_OPEN_SETTLEMENT.description: The value of the first settlement update of the instrument.

LIFETIME_OPEN_MARK_PRICE.description: The value of the first mark price update of the instrument.

LIFETIME_OPEN_QUOTE.description: The value of the first settlement update of the instrument, in the quote currency.

LIFETIME_HIGH_SETTLEMENT.description: The value of the highest recorded settlement update for this instrument.

LIFETIME_HIGH_SETTLEMENT_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time that the highest settlement value ever recorded occurs.

LIFETIME_HIGH_SETTLEMENT_TS.description: The timestamp of the highest settlement update ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_HIGH_MARK_PRICE.description: The value of the highest mark price update ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_HIGH_MARK_PRICE_SETTLEMENT.description: The settlement, at the point in time that the highest mark price value recorded occurs.

LIFETIME_HIGH_MARK_PRICE_TS.description: The timestamp of the highest mark price update ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_HIGH_QUOTE.description: The value of the highest settlement update (in the quote currency) ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_HIGH_QUOTE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time that the highest settlement (in the quote currency) value occurs.

LIFETIME_HIGH_QUOTE_TS.description: The timestamp of the highest settlement update (in the quote currency) ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_LOW_SETTLEMENT.description: The value of the lowest settlement update ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_LOW_SETTLEMENT_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time that the lowest settlement value ever recorded occurs.

LIFETIME_LOW_SETTLEMENT_TS.description: The timestamp of the lowest settlement update ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_LOW_MARK_PRICE.description: The value of the lowest mark price update ever executed on this instrument.

LIFETIME_LOW_MARK_PRICE_SETTLEMENT.description: The settlement, at the point in time that the lowest mark price value ever recorded occurs.

LIFETIME_LOW_MARK_PRICE_TS.description: The timestamp of the lowest mark price update ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_LOW_QUOTE.description: The value of the lowest settlement update (in the quote currency) ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_LOW_QUOTE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time that the lowest settlement update (in the quote currency) ever recorded occurs.

LIFETIME_LOW_QUOTE_TS.description: The timestamp of the lowest settlement update (in the quote currency) ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_TOTAL_OPEN_INTEREST_UPDATES.description: The total number of all updates that have ever been recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_SETTLEMENT_CHANGE.description: The value change from the LIFETIME. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

LIFETIME_MARK_PRICE_CHANGE.description: The value change from the LIFETIME. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

LIFETIME_QUOTE_CHANGE.description: The value change from the LIFETIME. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

LIFETIME_SETTLEMENT_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the LIFETIME. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

LIFETIME_MARK_PRICE_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the LIFETIME. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

LIFETIME_QUOTE_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the LIFETIME. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

Err.description: This object provides detailed information about an error encountered while processing the request. It includes an error code, a message explaining the error, and additional context about the parameters or values that caused the issue. This helps clients identify and resolve issues with their requests.

type.description: A public facing error type. If you want to treat a specific error use the type.

message.example: Not found: market parameter. Value test_market_does_not_exist not integrated yet. We list all markets in lowercase and transform the parameter sent, make sure you check the https://data-api.cryptocompare.com/spot/v1/markets endpoint for a list of all the supported TRADE_SPOT markets

param.description: The parameter that is responsible for the error

values.description: The values responsible for the error

UNIT.description: The level of granularity (e.g. MINUTE / HOUR / DAY).

TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the histo period. This refers to the first timestamp of the unit under consideration, not the last (e.g. for daily data the timestamp will refer to 00:00 GMT/UTC).

TYPE.description: The type of message this is. It helps identify the nature of the data being returned.

MARKET.description: The market / exchange under consideration (e.g. bitmex, deribit, ftx, etc).

INSTRUMENT.description: The unmapped instrument ID

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The mapped instrument ID, derived from our mapping rules

QUOTE_CURRENCY.description: The mapped to asset quote / counter symbol / coin (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY.description: The currency that the contract is settled in (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY.description: The currency that the contract size is denominated in (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

DENOMINATION_TYPE.description: VANILLA = (SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY = QUOTE_CURRENCY), INVERSE = (SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY = INDEX_UNDERLYING), QUANTO (SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY != INDEX_UNDERLYING or QUOTE_CURRENCY)

INDEX_UNDERLYING_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the index underlying asset (e.g., 1). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

QUOTE_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the asset quote / counter symbol / coin (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the currency that the contract is settled in (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the currency that the contract size is denominated in (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

TRANSFORM_FUNCTION.description: The transform function. This is the function we apply when we do mapping to change values into easier human readable ones and to make sure the mapped direction BASE - QUOTE is constant accross all instruments.

OPEN_SETTLEMENT.description: The open settlement value for the historical period, given in units of the underlying asset. This is based on the closest open interest update before the period start

OPEN_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price coresponding to the open settlement value for the historical period, given in units of the quote currency. This is based on the closest open interest update before the period start

OPEN_QUOTE.description: The open settlement for the historical period, given in units of the quote currency. This is based on the closest open interest update before the period start

HIGH_SETTLEMENT.description: The highest value the settlement reached during the historical period. If there were no messages in the time period, the open settlement value will be taken as the highest.

HIGH_SETTLEMENT_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, given in units of the quote currency, at the point in time where the open interest settlement value is highest. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening mark price will be given.

HIGH_MARK_PRICE.description: The highest value the mark price reached during the historical period. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening mark price will be given.

HIGH_MARK_PRICE_SETTLEMENT.description: The open interest settlement value, given in units of the underlying currency, at the point in time where the mark price is highest. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening settlement value will be given.

HIGH_QUOTE.description: The highest value, in units of the quote currency, the open interest settlement reached during the time period. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening settlement value will be given.

HIGH_QUOTE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, given in units of the quote currency, at the point in time where the open interest settlement value (in units of the quote currency) is highest. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening mark price will be given.

LOW_SETTLEMENT.description: The lowest value the settlement reached during the historical period. If there were no messages in the time period, the open settlement value will be taken as the lowest.

LOW_SETTLEMENT_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time where the open interest settlement value (in units of the underlying currency) is lowest. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening mark price will be given.

LOW_MARK_PRICE.description: The lowest value the mark price reached during the historical period. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening mark price will be given.

LOW_MARK_PRICE_SETTLEMENT.description: The open interest settlement value, given in units of the underlying currency, at the point in time where the mark price is lowest. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening settlement value will be given.

LOW_QUOTE.description: The lowest value, in units of the quote currency, that the open interest settlement reached during the time period. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening settlement value will be given.

LOW_QUOTE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time where the open interest settlement value (in units of the quote currency) is lowest. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening mark price will be given.

CLOSE_SETTLEMENT.description: The value of the last open interest settlement update in this time period. If there were no messages in the time period, the open settlement value will be given.

CLOSE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price corresponding to the last open interest update value in this time period. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening mark price will be given.

CLOSE_QUOTE.description: The open interest value of the last message of the period, given in units of the quote currency. If there were no messages in the time period, the open quote settlement value will be given.

FIRST_MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds of the first open interest update in this time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

FIRST_MESSAGE_SETTLEMENT.description: The open interest value of the first open interest settlement update in the time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

FIRST_MESSAGE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price corresponding to the first open interest update in the time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

FIRST_MESSAGE_QUOTE.description: The open interest value, given in units of the quote currency, of the first open interest update of the time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_SETTLEMENT.description: The highest open interest settlement value of the messages in the time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_SETTLEMENT_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time where the update with the highest settlement value occurred. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_SETTLEMENT_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the highest open interest settlement value update in this time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_MARK_PRICE.description: The highest mark price value of the messages in the time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_MARK_PRICE_SETTLEMENT.description: The open interest settlement, at the point in time where the update with the highest mark price occurred. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_MARK_PRICE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the highest open interest mark price value update in this time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_QUOTE.description: The highest settlement value, given in units of the quote currency, of the messages in the time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_QUOTE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time where the highest open interest settlement value (in units of the quote currency) of the messages in the time period occurred. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_QUOTE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the highest open interest quote value update in this time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

LOW_MESSAGE_SETTLEMENT.description: The lowest settlement value of the messages in the time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period).

LOW_MESSAGE_SETTLEMENT_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time where the lowest open interest value of the messagse in the time period occurred. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period).

LOW_MESSAGE_SETTLEMENT_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the lowest open interest settlement update in this time period. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

LOW_MESSAGE_MARK_PRICE.description: The lowest mark price value of the messages in the time period. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

LOW_MESSAGE_MARK_PRICE_SETTLEMENT.description: The open interest settlement value, at the point in time where the lowest mark price of the messages in the time period occurred. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period).

LOW_MESSAGE_MARK_PRICE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the lowest open interest mark price update in this time period. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

LOW_MESSAGE_QUOTE.description: The lowest open interest value, in the quote currency, of the messages in the time period. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

LOW_MESSAGE_QUOTE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time where the lowest open interest value (in the quote currency) of the messages in the time period occurred. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

LOW_MESSAGE_QUOTE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the lowest open interest value, given in the quote currency, in the time period. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

LAST_MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the last open interest update in this time period. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

LAST_MESSAGE_SETTLEMENT.description: The last open interest update settlement value in the time period. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

LAST_MESSAGE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price corresponding to the last open interest update value in the time period. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

LAST_MESSAGE_QUOTE.description: The last open interest value, in the quote currency, of the messsages in the time period. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

TOTAL_OPEN_INTEREST_UPDATES.description: The total number of message updates seen in this time period. This value will be 0 when there no messages in the time period.

MARKET.description: The market / exchange under consideration (e.g. Coinbase, Kraken, etc).

INSTRUMENT.description: The original unmapped instrument ID as provided by the exchange, which can have various formats (e.g., BTCUSD, BTC_USD, XBT-ZUSD, BTC-USD).

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The mapped instrument ID, derived from our our mapping rules

QUOTE_CURRENCY.description: The mapped to asset quote / counter symbol / coin (e.g. USD), only available on instruments that have mapping.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY.description: The currency that the contract is settled in (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY.description: The currency that the contract size is denominated in (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

INDEX_UNDERLYING_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the index underlying asset (e.g., 1). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

QUOTE_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the asset quote / counter symbol / coin (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the currency that the contract is settled in (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the currency that the contract size is denominated in (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

TRANSFORM_FUNCTION.description: The transform function. This is the function we apply when we do mapping to change values into easier human readable ones and to make sure the mapped direction BASE - QUOTE is constant accross all instruments.

ID.description: The open interest ID as reported by the market / exchange or the timestamp in seconds / millisconds / nanoseconds depending on the open interest dissemination frequency.

TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds as reported by the market / exchange or the received timestamp if the market / exchange does not provide one.

TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the reported timestamp

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds that the open interest value was received. This varies (from a few millisconds to a few seconds) from the open interest value taking place on the market / exchange depending on the market / exchange API options / rate limits

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the received timestamp.

SETTLEMENT.description: The total value of outstanding derivatives contracts, given in units of the underlying currency. This will be equal to QUOTE / MARK_PRICE

MARK_PRICE.description: The price at which the perpetual contract will be valued during the trading hours (unrealized pnl and liquidations) = QUOTE / SETTLEMENT

QUOTE.description: The value of outstanding contracts, given in units of the quote currency. This will be equal to SETTLEMENT * MARK_PRICE

SOURCE.description: The source of the open interest update (e.g. POLLING, STREAMING, GO, BLOB etc).

CCSEQ.description: Our internal sequence number for this open interest update, this is unique per market / exchange and instrument. Should always be increasing by 1 for each new trade we discover, not in chronological order.

STATUS.description: The status of the update.

Data.description: An array containing valid and invalid open interest updates for the requested time period. Open interest updates are ordered by CCSEQ, which generally reflects the order of their received timestamps. Any backfilled open interest updates that are added later will appear at the end of the array. This ensures a reliable and sequential view of open interest updates, including historical corrections. If an open interest update was initially deemed valid but later determined to have been sent in error or processed incorrectly the STATUS field will be changed to reflect this. We retain invalid open interest updates to maintain the continuity of CCSEQ and ensure there are no gaps in the sequence. You can elimiate invalid open interest updates from the response by setting the skip_invalid_messages paramater to true, keep in mind that by doing this you will have gaps in the CCSEQ of open interest update and you can no longer easily guarantee you have received all open interest updates.

MARKET.description: The market / exchange under consideration (e.g. Coinbase, Kraken, etc).

INSTRUMENT.description: The original unmapped instrument ID as provided by the exchange, which can have various formats (e.g., BTCUSD, BTC_USD, XBT-ZUSD, BTC-USD).

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The mapped instrument ID, derived from our our mapping rules

QUOTE_CURRENCY.description: The mapped to asset quote / counter symbol / coin (e.g. USD), only available on instruments that have mapping.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY.description: The currency that the contract is settled in (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY.description: The currency that the contract size is denominated in (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

INDEX_UNDERLYING_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the index underlying asset (e.g., 1). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

QUOTE_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the asset quote / counter symbol / coin (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the currency that the contract is settled in (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the currency that the contract size is denominated in (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

TRANSFORM_FUNCTION.description: The transform function. This is the function we apply when we do mapping to change values into easier human readable ones and to make sure the mapped direction BASE - QUOTE is constant accross all instruments.

ID.description: The open interest ID as reported by the market / exchange or the timestamp in seconds / millisconds / nanoseconds depending on the open interest dissemination frequency.

TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds as reported by the market / exchange or the received timestamp if the market / exchange does not provide one.

TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the reported timestamp

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds that the open interest value was received. This varies (from a few millisconds to a few seconds) from the open interest value taking place on the market / exchange depending on the market / exchange API options / rate limits

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the received timestamp.

SETTLEMENT.description: The total value of outstanding derivatives contracts, given in units of the underlying currency. This will be equal to QUOTE / MARK_PRICE

MARK_PRICE.description: The price at which the perpetual contract will be valued during the trading hours (unrealized pnl and liquidations) = QUOTE / SETTLEMENT

QUOTE.description: The value of outstanding contracts, given in units of the quote currency. This will be equal to SETTLEMENT * MARK_PRICE

SOURCE.description: The source of the open interest update (e.g. POLLING, STREAMING, GO, BLOB etc).

CCSEQ.description: Our internal sequence number for this open interest update, this is unique per market / exchange and instrument. Should always be increasing by 1 for each new trade we discover, not in chronological order.

STATUS.description: The status of the update.

Data.description: An array containing valid open interest updates for the requested time period. Open interest updates are ordered by CCSEQ, which generally reflects the order of their received timestamps. Any backfilled open interest updates that are added later will appear at the end of the array. This ensures a reliable and sequential view of open interest update data, including historical corrections. If an open interest update was initially deemed valid but later determined to have been sent in error or processed incorrectly, it is removed from this array and added to the "Invalid" array. We retain invalid open interest updates in a separate array to maintain the continuity of CCSEQ and ensure there are no gaps in the sequence.

MARKET.description: The market / exchange under consideration (e.g. coinbase, kraken, etc).

INSTRUMENT.description: The unmapped instrument ID

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The mapped instrument ID, derived from our mapping rules

QUOTE_CURRENCY.description: The mapped to asset quote / counter symbol / coin (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY.description: The currency that the contract is settled in (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY.description: The currency that the contract size is denominated in (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

DENOMINATION_TYPE.description: VANILLA = (SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY = QUOTE_CURRENCY), INVERSE = (SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY = INDEX_UNDERLYING), QUANTO (SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY != INDEX_UNDERLYING or QUOTE_CURRENCY)

INDEX_UNDERLYING_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the index underlying asset (e.g., 1). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

QUOTE_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the asset quote / counter symbol / coin (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the currency that the contract is settled in (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the currency that the contract size is denominated in (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

TRANSFORM_FUNCTION.description: The transform function. This is the function we apply when we do mapping to change values into easier human readable ones and to make sure the mapped direction BASE - QUOTE is constant accross all instruments.

CCSEQ.description: Our internal sequence number for this tick update. This is unique per market / exchange and trading pair / instrument. It will always be increasing by 1 for each new tick update we send.

INTERVAL_MS.description: The funding rate interval in milliseconds. This is how often the funding rate is calculated.

VALUE.description: The value of the funding rate.

VALUE_FLAG.description: The flag indicating whether the value has increased, decreased, or not changed

VALUE_LAST_UPDATE_TS.description: The timestamp, in seconds, as reported by the market / exchange. If the market / exchange does not provide this information, the received timestamp will be given.

VALUE_LAST_UPDATE_TS_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the timestamp as reported by the market / exchange. If the market / exchange does not provide this information, the nanosecond part of the timestamp received timestamp will be given.

LAST_UPDATE_ID.description: The ID of the last message update

LAST_UPDATE_CCSEQ.description: The CCSEQ of the last message update

CURRENT_HOUR_OPEN.description: The open funding rate value for the current hour. This is based on the closest update before the start of the current hour.

CURRENT_HOUR_HIGH.description: The highest funding rate value of the current hour. If there were no updates in the time period, the open funding rate value will be given.

CURRENT_HOUR_LOW.description: The lowest funding rate value of the current hour. If there have been no updates in the time period, the open funding rate value will be given.

CURRENT_HOUR_TOTAL_FUNDING_RATE_UPDATES.description: The total number of updates since the start of the current hour.

CURRENT_HOUR_CHANGE.description: The value change from the current HOUR. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_HOUR_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the current HOUR. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

CURRENT_DAY_OPEN.description: The open funding rate value for the current day. This is based on the closest update before the start of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC).

CURRENT_DAY_HIGH.description: The highest funding rate value of the current day. If there have been no updates in the time period, the open value will be given.

CURRENT_DAY_LOW.description: The lowest funding rate value of the current day. If there have been no updates in the time period, the open value will be given.

CURRENT_DAY_TOTAL_FUNDING_RATE_UPDATES.description: The total number of updates since the start of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC).

CURRENT_DAY_CHANGE.description: The value change from the current DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the current DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

CURRENT_WEEK_OPEN.description: The value of the closest update to Monday (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of this week. In a highly liquid market, this would be the last update that happened on the previous Sunday at (23:59:59 999 GMT/UTC). This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full weekly value.

CURRENT_WEEK_HIGH.description: The highest funding rate value of the current week, excluding the current day. I.e. Monday - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the week. If today is Monday, or there have been no updates in the time period, the CURRENT_WEEK_OPEN will be given.

CURRENT_WEEK_LOW.description: The lowest funding rate value of the current week, excluding the current day. I.e. Monday - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the week. If today is Monday, or there have been no updates in the time period, the CURRENT_WEEK_OPEN will be given.

CURRENT_WEEK_TOTAL_FUNDING_RATE_UPDATES.description: The total number of updates between Monday (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the week. If today is Monday, this value will be 0.

CURRENT_WEEK_CHANGE.description: The value change from the current WEEK. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_WEEK_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the current WEEK. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

CURRENT_MONTH_OPEN.description: The value of the closest update to the 1st day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of this month. In a highly liquid market, this would be the last update that happened on the previous month at (23:59:59 999 GMT/UTC). This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full monthly value.

CURRENT_MONTH_HIGH.description: The highest funding rate value of the current month, excluding the current day. I.e. 1st of the month - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the month. If today is the 1st of the month, or there have been no updates in the time period, the CURRENT_MONTH_OPEN will be given.

CURRENT_MONTH_LOW.description: The lowest funding rate value of the current month, excluding the current day. I.e. 1st of the month - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the month. If today is the 1st of the month, or there have been no updates in the time period, the CURRENT_MONTH_OPEN will be given.

CURRENT_MONTH_TOTAL_FUNDING_RATE_UPDATES.description: The total number of trades between 1st of the month (xxxx:xx:01 00:00:00 GMT/UTC) and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the month. If today is the 1st of the month, this value will be 0.

CURRENT_MONTH_CHANGE.description: The value change from the current MONTH. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_MONTH_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the current MONTH. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

CURRENT_YEAR_OPEN.description: The value of the closest trade to the 1st of January (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of this year. In a highly liquid market, this would be the last update that happened on on the 31st of December of the previous year (23:59:59 999 GMT/UTC). This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full yearly value.

CURRENT_YEAR_HIGH.description: The highest funding rate value of the current year, excluding the current day. I.e. the 1st of January - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the year. If today is the 1st of January, this value will be CURRENT_YEAR_OPEN.

CURRENT_YEAR_LOW.description: The lowest value between the CURRENT_YEAR_OPEN and the lowest update value of the year excluding the current day (1st of January - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the year). If today is the 1st of January, the CURRENT_YEAR_OPEN will be given.

CURRENT_YEAR_TOTAL_FUNDING_RATE_UPDATES.description: The total number of updates between the 1st of January (xxxx:01:01 00:00:00 GMT/UTC) and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the year. If today is 1st of January, this value will be 0.

CURRENT_YEAR_CHANGE.description: The value change from the current YEAR. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_YEAR_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the current YEAR. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

MOVING_24_HOUR_OPEN.description: The value of the closest update to the period start date (23 hours + current hour ago). This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculations to get the full 24 hour value.

MOVING_24_HOUR_HIGH.description: The highest funding rate value of the period. Here, the period runs from 24 hours ago to the beginning of the current hour (23 hours in total). If there have been no updates in the period, the MOVING_24_HOUR_OPEN will be given.

MOVING_24_HOUR_LOW.description: The lowest funding rate value of the period. Here, the period runs from 24 hours ago to the beginning of the current hour (23 hours in total). If there have been no updates in the period, the MOVING_24_HOUR_OPEN will be given.

MOVING_24_HOUR_TOTAL_FUNDING_RATE_UPDATE.description: The total number of updates between 24 hours ago and the beginning (xx:00:00) of the current hour (23 hours in total).

MOVING_24_HOUR_CHANGE.description: The value change from the MOVING_24_HOUR. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

MOVING_24_HOUR_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the MOVING_24_HOUR. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

MOVING_7_DAY_OPEN.description: The value of the update closest to the period start date. Here the period starts 6 days + current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC to now) ago. This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full 7 day value.

MOVING_7_DAY_HIGH.description: The highest funding rate value of the period running from seven days ago to the beginning of the current day (6 days in total). If there have been no updates, the MOVING_7_DAY_OPEN will be given.

MOVING_7_DAY_LOW.description: The lowest funding rate value of the period running from seven days ago to the beginning of the current day (6 days in total). If there have been no updates, the MOVING_7_DAY_OPEN will be given.

MOVING_7_DAY_TOTAL_FUNDING_RATE_UPDATES.description: The total number of updates between 7 days ago and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day (6 days in total).

MOVING_7_DAY_CHANGE.description: The value change from the MOVING_7_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

MOVING_7_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the MOVING_7_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

MOVING_30_DAY_OPEN.description: The value of the closest update to the period start date. Here, the period starts 29 days + current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC to now) ago.  This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full 30 day value.

MOVING_30_DAY_HIGH.description: The highest funding rate value of the period running from 30 days ago to the beginning of the current day (29 days in total). If there have been no updates in the time period, the MOVING_30_DAY_OPEN will be given.

MOVING_30_DAY_LOW.description: The lowest funding rate value of the period running from 30 days ago to the beginning of the current day (29 days in total). If there have been no updates in the time period, the MOVING_30_DAY_OPEN will be given.

MOVING_30_DAY_TOTAL_FUNDING_RATE_UPDATES.description: The total number of updates between 30 days ago and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day (29 days in total).

MOVING_30_DAY_CHANGE.description: The value change from the MOVING_30_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

MOVING_30_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the MOVING_30_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

MOVING_90_DAY_OPEN.description: The value of the closest update to the period start date. Here, the period starts 89 days + current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC to now) ago. This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full 90 day value.

MOVING_90_DAY_HIGH.description: The highest funding rate value of the period running from 90 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (89 days in total). If there have been no updates in the period, the MOVING_90_DAY_OPEN will be given.

MOVING_90_DAY_LOW.description: The lowest funding rate value of the period running from 90 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (89 days in total). If there have been no updates in the period, the MOVING_90_DAY_OPEN will be given.

MOVING_90_DAY_TOTAL_FUNDING_RATE_UPDATES.description: The total number of updates between 90 days ago and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day (89 days in total).

MOVING_90_DAY_CHANGE.description: The value change from the MOVING_90_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

MOVING_90_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the MOVING_90_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

MOVING_180_DAY_OPEN.description: The value of the closest update to the period start date. Here, the period starts 179 days + current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC to now) ago.  This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full 180 day value.

MOVING_180_DAY_HIGH.description: The highest funding rate value of the period running from 180 days ago to the beginning of the current day (179 days in total). If there have been no updates in the period, the MOVING_180_DAY_OPEN will be given.

MOVING_180_DAY_LOW.description: The lowest funding rate value of the period running from 180 days ago the beginning of the current day (179 days in total). If there have been no updates in the period, the MOVING_180_DAY_OPEN will be given.

MOVING_180_DAY_TOTAL_FUNDING_RATE_UPDATE.description: The total number of updates between 180 days ago and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day (179 days in total).

MOVING_180_DAY_CHANGE.description: The value change from the MOVING_180_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

MOVING_180_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the MOVING_180_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

MOVING_365_DAY_OPEN.description: The value of the closest update to the period start date. Here, the period starts 364 days + current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC to now) ago.  This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full 365 day value.

MOVING_365_DAY_HIGH.description: The highest funding rate value of the period running from 365 days ago to the beginning of the current day (364 days in total). If there have been no updates in the period, the MOVING_365_DAY_OPEN will be given.

MOVING_365_DAY_LOW.description: The lowest funding rate value of the period running from 365 days ago to the beginning of the curreny day (364 days in total). If there have been no updates in the period, the MOVING_365_DAY_OPEN will be given.

MOVING_365_DAY_TOTAL_FUNDING_RATE_UPDATE.description: The total number of updates between 365 days ago and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day (364 days in total).

MOVING_365_DAY_CHANGE.description: The value change from the MOVING_365_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

MOVING_365_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the MOVING_365_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

LIFETIME_FIRST_UPDATE_TS.description: The timestamp of the first update available for the instrument under consideration

LIFETIME_OPEN.description: The funding rate value of the first update of the instrument.

LIFETIME_HIGH.description: The funding rate value of the highest update ever executed on this instrument.

LIFETIME_HIGH_TS.description: The timestamp of the highest update ever executed on this instrument.

LIFETIME_LOW.description: The funding rate value of the lowest update ever executed on this instrument.

LIFETIME_LOW_TS.description: The timestamp of the lowest update ever executed on this instrument.

LIFETIME_TOTAL_FUNDING_RATE_UPDATES.description: The total number of all updates that have ever been executed on this instrument.

LIFETIME_CHANGE.description: The value change from the LIFETIME. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

LIFETIME_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the LIFETIME. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

Err.description: This object provides detailed information about an error encountered while processing the request. It includes an error code, a message explaining the error, and additional context about the parameters or values that caused the issue. This helps clients identify and resolve issues with their requests.

type.description: A public facing error type. If you want to treat a specific error use the type.

message.example: Not found: market parameter. Value test_market_does_not_exist not integrated yet. We list all markets in lowercase and transform the parameter sent, make sure you check the https://data-api.cryptocompare.com/spot/v1/markets endpoint for a list of all the supported TRADE_SPOT markets

param.description: The parameter that is responsible for the error

values.description: The values responsible for the error

UNIT.description: The level of granularity (e.g. MINUTE / HOUR / DAY).

TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the histo period. This refers to the first timestamp of the unit under consideration, not the last (e.g. for daily data the timestamp will refer to 00:00 GMT/UTC).

MARKET.description: The market / exchange under consideration (e.g. bitmex, deribit, ftx, etc).

INSTRUMENT.description: The unmapped instrument ID

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The mapped instrument ID, derived from our mapping rules

QUOTE_CURRENCY.description: The mapped to asset quote / counter symbol / coin  (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY.description: The currency that the contract is settled in (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY.description: The currency that the contract size is denominated in (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

DENOMINATION_TYPE.description: VANILLA = (SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY = QUOTE_CURRENCY), INVERSE = (SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY = INDEX_UNDERLYING), QUANTO (SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY != INDEX_UNDERLYING or QUOTE_CURRENCY)

INDEX_UNDERLYING_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the index underlying asset (e.g., 1). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

QUOTE_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the asset quote / counter symbol / coin (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the currency that the contract is settled in (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the currency that the contract size is denominated in (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

TRANSFORM_FUNCTION.description: The transform function. This is the function we apply when we do mapping to change values into easier human readable ones and to make sure the mapped direction BASE - QUOTE is constant accross all instruments.

INTERVAL_MS.description: The funding rate interval in milliseconds. This is how often the funding rate is calculated.

OPEN.description: The open funding rate value for the historical period, based on the closest funding rate update before the period starts

HIGH.description: The highest value the funding rate reached during the historical period. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening value will be taken as the highest.

LOW.description: The lowest value the funding rate reached during the historical period. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening value will be taken as the lowest.

CLOSE.description: The value of the last funding rate update in this time period. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening value will be taken as the close.

FIRST_MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds of the first funding rate update of the time period. Only available when there is at least one funding rate update in the time period.

LAST_MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds of the last funding rate update of the time period. Only available when there is at least one funding rate update in the time period.

FIRST_MESSAGE_VALUE.description: The funding rate value of the first received message of the time period. Only available when there is at least one funding rate update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_VALUE.description: The highest funding rate value of the messages that occurred within the time period. Only available when there is at least one funding rate update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds of the highest funding rate update of the time period. Only available when there is at least one funding rate update in the time period.

LOW_MESSAGE_VALUE.description: The lowest funding rate value of the messages that occurred within the time period. Only available when we have at least one funding rate update in the time period.

LOW_MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds of the lowest funding rate update of the time period. Only available when we have at least one funding rate update in the time period.

LAST_MESSAGE_VALUE.description: The funding rate value of the last received message of the time period. Only available when we have at least one funding rate update in the time period.

TOTAL_FUNDING_RATE_UPDATES.description: The total number of message updates seen in this time period. This will be 0 if there were no messages in the time period.

TYPE.description: The type of message this is. It helps identify the nature of the data being returned.

MARKET.description: The market / exchange under consideration (e.g. Coinbase, Kraken, etc.).

INSTRUMENT.description: The original unmapped instrument ID as provided by the exchange, which can have various formats (e.g., BTCUSD, BTC_USD, XBT-ZUSD, BTC-USD).

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The mapped instrument ID, derived from our mapping rules.

QUOTE_CURRENCY.description: Represents the quote asset or counter coin symbol, commonly known as the ticker (e.g., USD). This symbol may change in cases of asset rebranding. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY.description: The currency that the contract is settled in (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY.description: The currency that the contract size is denominated in (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

INDEX_UNDERLYING_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the index underlying asset (e.g., 1). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

QUOTE_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the asset quote / counter symbol / coin (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the currency that the contract is settled in (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the currency that the contract size is denominated in (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

TRANSFORM_FUNCTION.description: The transform function. This is the function we apply when we do mapping to change values into easier human readable ones and to make sure the mapped direction BASE - QUOTE is constant accross all instruments.

ID.description: Either the funding rate ID as reported by the exchange; or the timestamp in seconds / milliseconds / nanoseconds depending on the funding rate dissemination frequency.

TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds as reported by the exchange or the received timestamp if the exchange does not provide one.

TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the timestamp - also the number of nanoseconds after the original timestamp that the funding rate update occurred.

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds when we received the funding rate value. This may vary from the funding rate value taking place on the exchange by anything from a few milliseconds to a few seconds, depending on the exchange API options / rate limits

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the received timestamp - also the number of nanoseconds after the received timestamp that we received the funding rate value.

INTERVAL_MS.description: The funding rate interval in milliseconds. This is how often the funding rate is calculated.

VALUE.description: The funding rate value as given by the source.

SOURCE.description: The source of the index update (e.g. POLLING, STREAMING, GO, BLOB etc).

CCSEQ.description: Our internal sequence number for this index update, this is unique per exchange and instrument. Should always be increasing by 1 for each new trade we discover, not in chronological order.

STATUS.description: The status of the update.

Data.description: An array containing valid and invalid funding rate updates for the requested time period. Funding rate updates are ordered by CCSEQ, which generally reflects the order of their received timestamps. Any backfilled funding rate updates that are added later will appear at the end of the array. This ensures a reliable and sequential view of funding rate updates, including historical corrections. If an funding rate update was initially deemed valid but later determined to have been sent in error or processed incorrectly the STATUS field will be changed to reflect this. We retain invalid funding rate updates to maintain the continuity of CCSEQ and ensure there are no gaps in the sequence. You can elimiate invalid funding rate updates from the response by setting the skip_invalid_messages paramater to true, keep in mind that by doing this you will have gaps in the CCSEQ of funding rate update and you can no longer easily guarantee you have received all funding rate updates.

TYPE.description: The type of message this is. It helps identify the nature of the data being returned.

MARKET.description: The market / exchange under consideration (e.g. Coinbase, Kraken, etc.).

INSTRUMENT.description: The original unmapped instrument ID as provided by the exchange, which can have various formats (e.g., BTCUSD, BTC_USD, XBT-ZUSD, BTC-USD).

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The mapped instrument ID, derived from our mapping rules.

QUOTE_CURRENCY.description: Represents the quote asset or counter coin symbol, commonly known as the ticker (e.g., USD). This symbol may change in cases of asset rebranding. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY.description: The currency that the contract is settled in (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY.description: The currency that the contract size is denominated in (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

INDEX_UNDERLYING_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the index underlying asset (e.g., 1). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

QUOTE_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the asset quote / counter symbol / coin (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the currency that the contract is settled in (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the currency that the contract size is denominated in (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

TRANSFORM_FUNCTION.description: The transform function. This is the function we apply when we do mapping to change values into easier human readable ones and to make sure the mapped direction BASE - QUOTE is constant accross all instruments.

ID.description: Either the funding rate ID as reported by the exchange; or the timestamp in seconds / milliseconds / nanoseconds depending on the funding rate dissemination frequency.

TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds as reported by the exchange or the received timestamp if the exchange does not provide one.

TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the timestamp - also the number of nanoseconds after the original timestamp that the funding rate update occurred.

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds when we received the funding rate value. This may vary from the funding rate value taking place on the exchange by anything from a few milliseconds to a few seconds, depending on the exchange API options / rate limits

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the received timestamp - also the number of nanoseconds after the received timestamp that we received the funding rate value.

INTERVAL_MS.description: The funding rate interval in milliseconds. This is how often the funding rate is calculated.

VALUE.description: The funding rate value as given by the source.

SOURCE.description: The source of the index update (e.g. POLLING, STREAMING, GO, BLOB etc).

CCSEQ.description: Our internal sequence number for this index update, this is unique per exchange and instrument. Should always be increasing by 1 for each new trade we discover, not in chronological order.

STATUS.description: The status of the update.

Data.description: An array containing valid funding rate updates for the requested time period. Funding rate updates are ordered by CCSEQ, which generally reflects the order of their received timestamps. Any backfilled funding rate updates that are added later will appear at the end of the array. This ensures a reliable and sequential view of funding rate update data, including historical corrections. If an funding rate update was initially deemed valid but later determined to have been sent in error or processed incorrectly, it is removed from this array and added to the "Invalid" array. We retain invalid funding rate updates in a separate array to maintain the continuity of CCSEQ and ensure there are no gaps in the sequence.

METADATA_VERSION.description: The version of metadata, used for version conversions/migrates.

INSTRUMENT_STATUS.description: The status of the instrument, we only poll / stream / connect to the ACTIVE ones, for the RETIRED / IGNORED / EXPIRED / READY_FOR_DECOMMISSIONING means we no longer query/stream data.

INSTRUMENT.description: The instrument ID as it is on the exchange with small modifications - we do not allow the following characters inside isntrument ids: ,/&?

INSTRUMENT_MAPPING.description: The current mapping information for this instrument

INSTRUMENT_EXTERNAL_DATA.description: The full data we get from the polling endpoint for this specific instrument. This is a JSON stringified object with different properties per exchange.

INSTRUMENT_AVAILABLE_ON_INSTRUMENTS_ENDP.description: This flags the exchange instrument is currently available on instruments endpoint.

INDEX_ID.description: The id of the index the contract is based on.

INDEX_UNDERLYING.description: The underlying instrument of the index.

QUOTE_CURRENCY.description: The instrument that the contract is priced in.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY.description: The currency used to calculate contract PnL. The settlement currency can be different from the index underlying or quote currencies.

DENOMINATION_TYPE.description: VANILLA = (SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY = QUOTE_CURRENCY), INVERSE = (SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY = INDEX_UNDERLYING), QUANTO (SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY != INDEX_UNDERLYING or QUOTE_CURRENCY)

CONTRACT_CURRENCY.description: The denomination of the CONTRACT_SIZE.

CONTRACT_SIZE.description: The contract size - how much of the contract currency does one contract contain.

TICK_SIZE.description: The minimum amount the price can move, denominated in QUOTE_CURRENCY

DELIVERY_METHOD.description: The settlement delivery method on the derivative product.

CONTRACT_TERM.description: The term / duration the contract represents e.g. 3xMONTH.

FUNDING_INTERVAL_HOURS.description: Time between funding measured in hours, if 0 it means the funding interval is continuous.

CONTRACT_CREATION_TS.description: The contract creation timestamp we get for the specific derivative instrument.

CONTRACT_EXPIRATION_TS.description: The contract expiration timestamp we get for the specific derivative instrument. Not needed for PERPETUAL contract types.

CONTRACT_EXPIRATION_YEAR.description: Year in which the contract expires.

CONTRACT_EXPIRATION_MONTH_CODE.description: Month in which the contract expires.

ARCHIVE_STATUS.description: The archive status of the instrument

HOST_MIGRATION_STATUS.description: The migration status of the symbol, we only poll / stream / connect empty or SETTLED

ORDERBOOK_MAX_DEPTH.description: The maximum number of positions to keep in the orderbook, for each side.

FIRST_OB_L2_MINUTE_SNAPSHOT_TS.description: Timestamp of the initial Level 2 minute snapshot.

LAST_OB_L2_MINUTE_SNAPSHOT_TS.description: Timestamp of the latest Level 2 minute snapshot.

INSTRUMENT_TRADE_FUTURES_REST_URL.description: The URL we send to the proxy swarm to get TRADE_FUTURES for the instrument.

INSTRUMENT_TRADE_FUTURES_IS_READY_FOR_ST.description: This flags the exchange instrument as in ready to consume TRADE_FUTURES via a streaming integration.

TOTAL_TRADES_FUTURES.description: This is both the CCSEQ and the total TRADES_FUTURES we have processed on this instrument
