LIFETIME_OPEN_SETTLEMENT.description: The value of the first settlement update of the instrument.

LIFETIME_OPEN_MARK_PRICE.description: The value of the first mark price update of the instrument.

LIFETIME_OPEN_QUOTE.description: The value of the first settlement update of the instrument, in the quote currency.

LIFETIME_HIGH_SETTLEMENT.description: The value of the highest recorded settlement update for this instrument.

LIFETIME_HIGH_SETTLEMENT_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time that the highest settlement value ever recorded occurs.

LIFETIME_HIGH_SETTLEMENT_TS.description: The timestamp of the highest settlement update ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_HIGH_MARK_PRICE.description: The value of the highest mark price update ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_HIGH_MARK_PRICE_SETTLEMENT.description: The settlement, at the point in time that the highest mark price value recorded occurs.

LIFETIME_HIGH_MARK_PRICE_TS.description: The timestamp of the highest mark price update ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_HIGH_QUOTE.description: The value of the highest settlement update (in the quote currency) ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_HIGH_QUOTE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time that the highest settlement (in the quote currency) value occurs.

LIFETIME_HIGH_QUOTE_TS.description: The timestamp of the highest settlement update (in the quote currency) ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_LOW_SETTLEMENT.description: The value of the lowest settlement update ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_LOW_SETTLEMENT_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time that the lowest settlement value ever recorded occurs.

LIFETIME_LOW_SETTLEMENT_TS.description: The timestamp of the lowest settlement update ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_LOW_MARK_PRICE.description: The value of the lowest mark price update ever executed on this instrument.

LIFETIME_LOW_MARK_PRICE_SETTLEMENT.description: The settlement, at the point in time that the lowest mark price value ever recorded occurs.

LIFETIME_LOW_MARK_PRICE_TS.description: The timestamp of the lowest mark price update ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_LOW_QUOTE.description: The value of the lowest settlement update (in the quote currency) ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_LOW_QUOTE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time that the lowest settlement update (in the quote currency) ever recorded occurs.

LIFETIME_LOW_QUOTE_TS.description: The timestamp of the lowest settlement update (in the quote currency) ever recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_TOTAL_OPEN_INTEREST_OPTIONS_UPD.description: The total number of all updates that have ever been recorded for this instrument.

LIFETIME_SETTLEMENT_CHANGE.description: The value change from the LIFETIME. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

LIFETIME_MARK_PRICE_CHANGE.description: The value change from the LIFETIME. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

LIFETIME_QUOTE_CHANGE.description: The value change from the LIFETIME. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

LIFETIME_SETTLEMENT_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the LIFETIME. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

LIFETIME_MARK_PRICE_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the LIFETIME. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

LIFETIME_QUOTE_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the LIFETIME. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

Err.description: This object provides detailed information about an error encountered while processing the request. It includes an error code, a message explaining the error, and additional context about the parameters or values that caused the issue. This helps clients identify and resolve issues with their requests.

type.description: A public facing error type. If you want to treat a specific error use the type.

message.example: Not found: market parameter. Value test_market_does_not_exist not integrated yet. We list all markets in lowercase and transform the parameter sent, make sure you check the https://data-api.cryptocompare.com/spot/v1/markets endpoint for a list of all the supported TRADE_SPOT markets

param.description: The parameter that is responsible for the error

values.description: The values responsible for the error

UNIT.description: The level of granularity (e.g. MINUTE / HOUR / DAY).

TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the histo period. This refers to the first timestamp of the unit under consideration, not the last (e.g. for daily data the timestamp will refer to 00:00 GMT/UTC).

TYPE.description: The type of message this is. It helps identify the nature of the data being returned.

MARKET.description: The market / exchange under consideration (e.g. bitmex, deribit, ftx, etc).

INSTRUMENT.description: The unmapped instrument ID

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The mapped instrument ID, derived from our mapping rules

QUOTE_CURRENCY.description: The mapped to asset quote / counter symbol / coin (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY.description: The currency that the contract is settled in (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY.description: The currency that the contract size is denominated in (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

STRIKE_CURRENCY.description: The strike currency of the contract underlying index.

INDEX_UNDERLYING_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the index underlying asset (e.g., 1). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

QUOTE_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the asset quote / counter symbol / coin (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the currency that the contract is settled in (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the currency that the contract size is denominated in (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

STRIKE_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the strike currency of the contract underlying index. This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

TRANSFORM_FUNCTION.description: The transform function. This is the function we apply when we do mapping to change values into easier human readable ones and to make sure the mapped direction BASE - QUOTE is constant accross all instruments.

OPEN_SETTLEMENT.description: The open settlement value for the historical period, given in units of the underlying asset. This is based on the closest open interest update before the period start

OPEN_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price coresponding to the open settlement value for the historical period, given in units of the quote currency. This is based on the closest open interest update before the period start

OPEN_QUOTE.description: The open settlement for the historical period, given in units of the quote currency. This is based on the closest open interest update before the period start

HIGH_SETTLEMENT.description: The highest value the settlement reached during the historical period. If there were no messages in the time period, the open settlement value will be taken as the highest.

HIGH_SETTLEMENT_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, given in units of the quote currency, at the point in time where the open interest settlement value is highest. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening mark price will be given.

HIGH_MARK_PRICE.description: The highest value the mark price reached during the historical period. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening mark price will be given.

HIGH_MARK_PRICE_SETTLEMENT.description: The open interest settlement value, given in units of the underlying currency, at the point in time where the mark price is highest. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening settlement value will be given.

HIGH_QUOTE.description: The highest value, in units of the quote currency, the open interest settlement reached during the time period. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening settlement value will be given.

HIGH_QUOTE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, given in units of the quote currency, at the point in time where the open interest settlement value (in units of the quote currency) is highest. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening mark price will be given.

LOW_SETTLEMENT.description: The lowest value the settlement reached during the historical period. If there were no messages in the time period, the open settlement value will be taken as the lowest.

LOW_SETTLEMENT_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time where the open interest settlement value (in units of the underlying currency) is lowest. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening mark price will be given.

LOW_MARK_PRICE.description: The lowest value the mark price reached during the historical period. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening mark price will be given.

LOW_MARK_PRICE_SETTLEMENT.description: The open interest settlement value, given in units of the underlying currency, at the point in time where the mark price is lowest. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening settlement value will be given.

LOW_QUOTE.description: The lowest value, in units of the quote currency, that the open interest settlement reached during the time period. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening settlement value will be given.

LOW_QUOTE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time where the open interest settlement value (in units of the quote currency) is lowest. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening mark price will be given.

CLOSE_SETTLEMENT.description: The value of the last open interest settlement update in this time period. If there were no messages in the time period, the open settlement value will be given.

CLOSE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price corresponding to the last open interest update value in this time period. If there were no messages in the time period, the opening mark price will be given.

CLOSE_QUOTE.description: The open interest value of the last message of the period, given in units of the quote currency. If there were no messages in the time period, the open quote settlement value will be given.

FIRST_MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds of the first open interest update in this time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

FIRST_MESSAGE_SETTLEMENT.description: The open interest value of the first open interest settlement update in the time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

FIRST_MESSAGE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price corresponding to the first open interest update in the time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

FIRST_MESSAGE_QUOTE.description: The open interest value, given in units of the quote currency, of the first open interest update of the time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_SETTLEMENT.description: The highest open interest settlement value of the messages in the time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_SETTLEMENT_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time where the update with the highest settlement value occurred. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_SETTLEMENT_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the highest open interest settlement value update in this time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_MARK_PRICE.description: The highest mark price value of the messages in the time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_MARK_PRICE_SETTLEMENT.description: The open interest settlement, at the point in time where the update with the highest mark price occurred. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_MARK_PRICE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the highest open interest mark price value update in this time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_QUOTE.description: The highest settlement value, given in units of the quote currency, of the messages in the time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_QUOTE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time where the highest open interest settlement value (in units of the quote currency) of the messages in the time period occurred. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

HIGH_MESSAGE_QUOTE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the highest open interest quote value update in this time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period.

LOW_MESSAGE_SETTLEMENT.description: The lowest settlement value of the messages in the time period. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period).

LOW_MESSAGE_SETTLEMENT_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time where the lowest open interest value of the messagse in the time period occurred. Only available when there is at least one open interest update in the time period).

LOW_MESSAGE_SETTLEMENT_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the lowest open interest settlement update in this time period. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

LOW_MESSAGE_MARK_PRICE.description: The lowest mark price value of the messages in the time period. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

LOW_MESSAGE_MARK_PRICE_SETTLEMENT.description: The open interest settlement value, at the point in time where the lowest mark price of the messages in the time period occurred. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period).

LOW_MESSAGE_MARK_PRICE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the lowest open interest mark price update in this time period. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

LOW_MESSAGE_QUOTE.description: The lowest open interest value, in the quote currency, of the messages in the time period. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

LOW_MESSAGE_QUOTE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price, at the point in time where the lowest open interest value (in the quote currency) of the messages in the time period occurred. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

LOW_MESSAGE_QUOTE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the lowest open interest value, given in the quote currency, in the time period. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

LAST_MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the last open interest update in this time period. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

LAST_MESSAGE_SETTLEMENT.description: The last open interest update settlement value in the time period. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

LAST_MESSAGE_MARK_PRICE.description: The mark price corresponding to the last open interest update value in the time period. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

LAST_MESSAGE_QUOTE.description: The last open interest value, in the quote currency, of the messsages in the time period. Only available when we have at least one open interest update in the time period.

TOTAL_OPEN_INTEREST_OPTIONS_UPDATES.description: The total number of message updates seen in this time period. This value will be 0 when there no messages in the time period.

MARKET.description: The market / exchange under consideration (e.g. Coinbase, Kraken, etc).

INSTRUMENT.description: The original unmapped instrument ID as provided by the exchange, which can have various formats (e.g.,s BTCUSD, BTC_USD, XBT-ZUSD, BTC-USD).

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The mapped instrument ID, derived from our our mapping rules

QUOTE_CURRENCY.description: The mapped to asset quote / counter symbol / coin (e.g. USD), only available on instruments that have mapping.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY.description: The currency that the contract is settled in (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY.description: The currency that the contract size is denominated in (e.g. USD). Only available on instruments that have mapping.

INDEX_UNDERLYING_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the index underlying asset (e.g., 1). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

QUOTE_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the asset quote / counter symbol / coin (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the currency that the contract is settled in (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the currency that the contract size is denominated in (e.g. 5). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

STRIKE_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the strike currency of the contract underlying index. This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

TRANSFORM_FUNCTION.description: The transform function. This is the function we apply when we do mapping to change values into easier human readable ones and to make sure the mapped direction BASE - QUOTE is constant accross all instruments.

ID.description: The open interest ID as reported by the market / exchange or the timestamp in seconds / millisconds / nanoseconds depending on the open interest dissemination frequency.

TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds as reported by the market / exchange or the received timestamp if the market / exchange does not provide one.

TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the reported timestamp

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds that the open interest value was received. This varies (from a few millisconds to a few seconds) from the open interest value taking place on the market / exchange depending on the market / exchange API options / rate limits

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the received timestamp.

SETTLEMENT.description: The total value of outstanding derivatives contracts, given in units of the underlying currency. This will be equal to QUOTE / MARK_PRICE

MARK_PRICE.description: The price at which the perpetual contract will be valued during the trading hours (unrealized pnl and liquidations) = QUOTE / SETTLEMENT

QUOTE.description: The value of outstanding contracts, given in units of the quote currency. This will be equal to SETTLEMENT * MARK_PRICE

SOURCE.description: The source of the open interest update (e.g. POLLING, STREAMING, GO, BLOB etc).

CCSEQ.description: Our internal sequence number for this open interest update, this is unique per market / exchange and instrument. Should always be increasing by 1 for each new trade we discover, not in chronological order.

STATUS.description: The status of the update.

Data.description: An array containing valid and invalid open interest updates for the requested time period. Open interest updates are ordered by CCSEQ, which generally reflects the order of their received timestamps. Any backfilled open interest updates that are added later will appear at the end of the array. This ensures a reliable and sequential view of open interest updates, including historical corrections. If an open interest update was initially deemed valid but later determined to have been sent in error or processed incorrectly the STATUS field will be changed to reflect this. We retain invalid open interest updates to maintain the continuity of CCSEQ and ensure there are no gaps in the sequence. You can elimiate invalid open interest updates from the response by setting the skip_invalid_messages paramater to true, keep in mind that by doing this you will have gaps in the CCSEQ of open interest update and you can no longer easily guarantee you have received all open interest updates.

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The mapped instrument ID, derived from our our mapping rules

TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the reported timestamp

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the received timestamp.

MARK_PRICE.description: The price at which the perpetual contract will be valued during the trading hours (unrealized pnl and liquidations) = QUOTE / SETTLEMENT

QUOTE.description: The value of outstanding contracts, given in units of the quote currency. This will be equal to SETTLEMENT * MARK_PRICE

SOURCE.description: The source of the open interest update (e.g. POLLING, STREAMING, GO, BLOB etc).

STATUS.description: The status of the update.

Data.description: An array containing valid and invalid mesagess for the requested time period. Messages are ordered by CCSEQ, which generally reflects the order of their received timestamps. Any backfilled mesagess that are added later will appear at the end of the array. This ensures a reliable and sequential view of mesagess, including historical corrections. If a mesagess was initially deemed valid but later determined to have been sent in error or processed incorrectly the STATUS field will be changed to reflect this. We retain invalid mesagess to maintain the continuity of CCSEQ and ensure there are no gaps in the sequence. You can elimiate invalid mesagess from the response by setting the skip_invalid_messages paramater to true, keep in mind that by doing this you will have gaps in the CCSEQ of mesagess and you can no longer easily guarantee you have received all mesagess

METADATA_VERSION.description: The version of metadata, used for version conversions/migrates.

INSTRUMENT_STATUS.description: The status of the instrument, we only poll / stream / connect to the ACTIVE ones, for the RETIRED / IGNORED / EXPIRED / READY_FOR_DECOMMISSIONING means we no longer query/stream data.

INSTRUMENT.description: The instrument ID as it is on the exchange with small modifications - we do not allow the following characters inside isntrument ids: ,/&?

INSTRUMENT_MAPPING.description: The current mapping information for this instrument

INSTRUMENT_EXTERNAL_DATA.description: The full data we get from the polling endpoint for this specific instrument. This is a JSON stringified object with different properties per exchange.

INSTRUMENT_AVAILABLE_ON_INSTRUMENTS_ENDP.description: This flags the exchange instrument is currently available on instruments endpoint.

INDEX_ID.description: The id of the index the contract is based on.

INDEX_UNDERLYING.description: The underlying instrument of the index.

QUOTE_CURRENCY.description: The instrument that the contract is priced in.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY.description: The currency used to calculate contract PnL. The settlement currency can be different from the index underlying or quote currencies.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY.description: The denomination of the CONTRACT_SIZE.

CONTRACT_SIZE.description: The contract size - how much of the contract currency does one contract contain.

TICK_SIZE.description: The minimum amount the price can move, denominated in QUOTE_CURRENCY

CONTRACT_CREATION_TS.description: The contract creation timestamp we get for the specific derivative instrument.

CONTRACT_EXPIRATION_TS.description: The contract expiration timestamp we get for the specific derivative instrument. Not needed for PERPETUAL contract types.

CONTRACT_EXPIRATION_YEAR.description: Year in which the contract expires.

CONTRACT_EXPIRATION_MONTH_CODE.description: Month in which the contract expires.

ARCHIVE_STATUS.description: The archive status of the instrument

HOST_MIGRATION_STATUS.description: The migration status of the symbol, we only poll / stream / connect empty or SETTLED

BASE_CURRENCY.description: The base currency of the contract underlying index.

MIN_TRADE_AMOUNT.description: The minimum amount of contracts you can trade.

FIRST_OB_L2_MINUTE_SNAPSHOT_TS.description: Timestamp of the initial Level 2 minute snapshot.

LAST_OB_L2_MINUTE_SNAPSHOT_TS.description: Timestamp of the latest Level 2 minute snapshot.

INSTRUMENT_TRADE_OPTIONS_REST_URI.description: This is used to build up the request in some cases, this is where we put the id we use when querying for TRADE_OPTIONS.

INSTRUMENT_TRADE_OPTIONS_REST_URL.description: The URL we send to the proxy swarm to get TRADE_OPTIONS for the instrument.

INSTRUMENT_TRADE_OPTIONS_STREAMING_SUBSC.description: This is used to build up the subscription in some cases, this is where we put the id we use when subscribing for TRADE_OPTIONS on this instrument.

INSTRUMENT_TRADE_OPTIONS_IS_READY_FOR_ST.description: This flags the exchange instrument as in ready to consume TRADE_OPTIONS via a streaming integration.

TOTAL_TRADES_OPTIONS.description: This is both the CCSEQ and the total TRADES_OPTIONS we have processed on this instrument

LAST_CONCURRENT_BATCH_OF_TRADES_OPTIONS_.description: The timestamp last encountered where the batch of trades from TRADES_OPTIONS all occured at the same time. This is an issue when making the next request that requires polling by timestamp as a start/from parameter

INSTRUMENT_TRADE_OPTIONS_FROM_POLLING_RE.description: The last time we received a request from the proxy swarm with TRADE_OPTIONS for this instrument.
The last time we sent a request to the proxy swarm to get TRADE_OPTIONS for the instrument.
The next time we expect to make a request for TRADE_OPTIONS on this instrument.

INSTRUMENT_TRADE_OPTIONS_FROM_POLLING_LA.description: The last proxied REST request we sent to the proxy swarm to get TRADE_OPTIONS for the instrument.

FIRST_TRADE_OPTIONS_FROM_POLLING.description: This is the first TRADE_OPTIONS that we have seen on the specific source type in internal format.

LAST_TRADE_OPTIONS_FROM_POLLING.description: This is the last TRADE_OPTIONS that we have seen on the specific source type in internal format.

FIRST_TRADE_OPTIONS_FROM_POLLING_EXTERNA.description: This is the first TRADE_OPTIONS that we have seen on the specific source type in external format.

LAST_TRADE_OPTIONS_FROM_POLLING_EXTERNAL.description: This is the last TRADE_OPTIONS that we have seen on the specific trade source in external format.

UNSTRUCTURED_TRADE_OPTIONS_FROM_POLLING_.description: This is any extra helper TRADE_OPTIONS data that we would need for creating polling requests or subscribing with non standard information and anything that is very specific to one exchange API/Integration and it does not fit any of the other existing fields and is definitly only updated or written in only one service.

FIRST_TRADE_OPTIONS_FROM_STREAMING.description: This is the first TRADE_OPTIONS that we have seen on the specific source type in internal format.

LAST_TRADE_OPTIONS_FROM_STREAMING.description: This is the last TRADE_OPTIONS that we have seen on the specific source type in internal format.

FIRST_TRADE_OPTIONS_FROM_STREAMING_EXTER.description: This is the first TRADE_OPTIONS that we have seen on the specific source type in external format.

LAST_TRADE_OPTIONS_FROM_STREAMING_EXTERN.description: This is the last TRADE_OPTIONS that we have seen on the specific trade source in external format.

UNSTRUCTURED_TRADE_OPTIONS_FROM_STREAMIN.description: This is any extra helper TRADE_OPTIONS data that we would need for creating polling requests or subscribing with non standard information and anything that is very specific to one exchange API/Integration and it does not fit any of the other existing fields and is definitly only updated or written in only one service.

FIRST_TRADE_OPTIONS_FROM_GO.description: This is the first TRADE_OPTIONS that we have seen on the specific source type in internal format.

LAST_TRADE_OPTIONS_FROM_GO.description: This is the last TRADE_OPTIONS that we have seen on the specific source type in internal format.

Err.description: This object provides detailed information about an error encountered while processing the request. It includes an error code, a message explaining the error, and additional context about the parameters or values that caused the issue. This helps clients identify and resolve issues with their requests.

type.description: A public facing error type. If you want to treat a specific error use the type.

message.example: Not found: market parameter. Value test_market_does_not_exist not integrated yet. We list all markets in lowercase and transform the parameter sent, make sure you check the https://data-api.cryptocompare.com/spot/v1/markets endpoint for a list of all the supported TRADE_SPOT markets

param.description: The parameter that is responsible for the error

values.description: The values responsible for the error

EXCHANGE_STATUS.description: The status of the exchange. We only poll / stream / connect to the ACTIVE ones, for the RETIRED ones we no longer query for data

MAPPED_INSTRUMENTS_TOTAL.description: The total number of instruments that have been verified by our mapping team and have been properly assigned with a base, quote, mapping function, and other necessary fields. This is done to ensure that pairs like XXBTZUSD are accurately mapped to BTC-USD and that the pair refers to the correct assets rather than using the same asset id to represent different assets.

UNMAPPED_INSTRUMENTS_TOTAL.description: The number of instruments that have not yet been verified by our mapping team.

INSTRUMENT_STATUS.description: An object with the total number of instrument for each of the available instrument statuses.

ACTIVE.description: The total number of instruments currently available on the market, which are considered active. An active instrument is defined as an instrument from which we retrieve data and have either already mapped or are planning to map.

IGNORED.description: The total number of instruments available on the market that are classified as ignored, meaning that we do not plan to map them. Ignored instruments are those from which we do retrieve data but do not have any intention to map.

RETIRED.description: The total number of instruments that are classified as retired, meaning that they are no longer actively traded on the market. These instruments have ceased trading, and as such, we do not retrieve data from them but we have mapped them already.

EXPIRED.description: The total number of instruments that are classified as expired, meaning that they are mapped instruments that are no longer actively traded on the market. These expired instruments are typically futures or options instruments that have reached their expiration date and are no longer available for trading. While we have previously mapped these instruments, we do not retrieve any data from them since they are no longer actively traded.

TOTAL_TRADES_OPTIONS.description: The total number of options trades that this exchange has processed.

TOTAL_OPEN_INTEREST_OPTIONS_UPDATES.description: The total number of options open interest updates that this exchange has processed.

ID.description: The unique identifier for the exchange entry

EXCHANGE_INTERNAL_NAME.description: Internal mapped name for a specific exchange

URI.description: The uri path that this exchange will be found on / url-slug

COMMENT.description: Any internal comments you might have for this exchange

IS_PUBLIC.description: This is flagged to false when exchanges are deleted/hidden

ASSIGNED_TO.description: Internal user id of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the exchange

ASSIGNED_TO_USERNAME.description: Internal username of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the exchange at the time of the exchange assignment (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

CREATED_ON.description: Exchange internal creation unix ts in our system

CREATED_BY.description: Internal user id of the user who created the exchange

CREATED_BY_USERNAME.description: Internal username of the user who created the exchange at the time of the exchange creation (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

UPDATED_ON.description: Exchange internal last updated unix ts in our system

UPDATED_BY.description: Internal user id of the user who last updated the exchange

UPDATED_BY_USERNAME.description: Internal username of the user who last updated the internal information of the exchange at the time of the exchange update (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

ASSIGNED_TO_INTEGRATION_MAIN.description: Internal user id of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the exchange integration

ASSIGNED_TO_USERNAME_INTEGRATION_MAIN.description: Internal username of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the exchange integration at the time of the exchange assignment (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

ASSIGNED_TO_INTEGRATION_BACKUP.description: Internal user id of the user who is the backup for updating and maintaining the exchange integration

ASSIGNED_TO_USERNAME_INTEGRATION_BACKUP.description: Internal username of the user who is the backup for maintaining the exchange integration at the time of the exchange assignment (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

ASSIGNED_TO_BUSINESS_OR_CONTRACT.description: Internal user id of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the exchange contract data

ASSIGNED_TO_USERNAME_BUSINESS_OR_CONTRAC.description: Internal username of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the exchange contract data at the time of the exchange assignment (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

PUBLIC_NOTICE.description: A public notice for this exchange.

EXCHANGE_SUSPENSION_REASON.description: This specifies the underlying cause leading to the suspension of trading activities on the exchange. This information is critical for transparency and assists in the decision-making process for users and stakeholders. Selecting an option from this dropdown provides clarity on the nature of the suspension, whether it's temporary or permanent.

TRADING_PERMANENTLY_SUSPENDED_DATE.description: The retire date of the exchange is indicated as (yyyy-mm-dd).

NAME.description: The full name of the exchange, e.g. Coinbase.

LAUNCH_DATE.description: The launch date of the exchange is indicated as (yyyy-mm-dd).

IS_EXCLUDED_FROM_METRICS_AND_TOPLISTS.description: Indicates whether the exchange instruments should be excluded from the overall volumes and asset markets toplist. Basically exclude it from all aggregations.

HAS_SPOT_TRADING.description: This is set to true if is a centralized exchange and it offers spot trading.

HAS_FUTURES_TRADING.description: This is set to true if is a centralized exchange and it offers futures trading.

HAS_INDEX_PUBLISHING.description: This is set to true if is a centralized exchange and it offers index publishing.

HAS_OPTIONS_TRADING.description: This is set to true if is a centralized exchange and it offers options trading.

OPTIONS_TRADING_MECHANISMS.description: Defines the operational mechanisms used for options trading on the exchange.

NAME.description: The name of the trading mechanism

OPTIONS_EXERCISE_STYLES.description: Methods allowed for exercising options positions.

NAME.description: The name of the exercise style
The name of the settlement type

OPTIONS_EXPIRY_INTERVALS.description: What variety of expiry date intervals is offered for options instruments on the exchange. An exchange may offer different expiry intervals for different underlying assets.

NAME.description: The options contract term

OPTIONS_STRIKE_INTERVAL_METHODS.description: Defines how exchanges determine the spacing between individual strike prices within the available range.

NAME.description: The strike interval method

OPTIONS_STRIKE_BOUNDARY_METHODS.description: Defines the methodology exchanges use to determine how far from the current price they will list option strikes.

NAME.description: The strike boundary method

OPTIONS_API_ACCESS_PERMITTED_ROLES.description: Defines role-based access control for the Options API. This configuration restricts Data API access to users assigned specific roles, as specified in a JSON array. Each role entry is validated to ensure compliance with designated role names and permissions, allowing for controlled API access and streamlined role management.

HAS_DEX_TRADING.description: This is set to true if is a decentralized exchange and it offers spot trading that is based on automated market making smart contract.

WEBSITE_URL.description: The link for the official exchange website.

BLOG_URL.description: The link for the official blog.

INCORPORATION_DOCUMENT_URL.description: The URL providing access to the projectâ€™s incorporation documents. These documents offer legal information about the companyâ€™s establishment and its legal standing.

OTHER_DOCUMENT_URLS.description: Other documents that might be relevant to the exchange, they should all be PDFs.

TYPE.description: The category of document being uploaded.

VERSION.description: The version number of the document if applicable.

ORIGINAL_SOURCE_URL.description: The original URL on the exchange website where this document was found or downloaded from.

COMMENT.description: Additional notes or context about the document.

EXCHANGE_CERTIFICATIONS.description: Defines the specific certifications or accreditations that an exchange has obtained.

NAME.description: The name of the certification or accreditation

ID.description: The certification id.

URL.description: The URL of cerification document if there is one.

SUPPORT_CONTACT_INFORMATION.description: Various channels through which customers can reach out to the exchange for support.

DETAILS.description: Specific details like email address, phone number, URL, etc., for the selected contact medium.

COMMENTS.description: Any additional comments or notes regarding the support contact.

CONTROLLED_ADDRESSES.description: The list of designated addresses used to manage and store assets within an investment portfolio or on behalf of clients. This includes addresses where cryptocurrencies, securities, or other assets are held, reflecting the diverse nature of modern investment strategies. It encompasses addresses used by exchanges, ETFs, and companies to maintain their investment reserves or operational funds.

BLOCKCHAIN.description: The is linked to the asset representing a specific chain.

ADDRESS.description: The address of the smart contracts, external user accounts or other account

ADDRESS_PURPOSE.description: The role of the address within the company's operations, aiding in precise asset management and regulatory compliance. This categorization distinguishes between addresses for investments, client custody, and operational expenses, streamlining asset control and reporting.

CONTROL_TYPE.description: Classifies the level and nature of control the company exercises over various cryptocurrency addresses. This categorization helps delineate the operational and security protocols associated with each address, ranging from single-key direct control to multi-signatory arrangements and even non-control strategies.

NAME.description: The name of the address. Contract name or just the common name for this address.

DESCRIPTION.description: A description for the address.

IS_INCLUDED_IN_CADLI.description: Indicates whether the asset is part of the CADLI index, which calculates the price of an asset in USD. This field is crucial for tracking asset inclusion in CADLI, aiding in data analysis and decision-making processes related to asset pricing.

EXCHANGE_ALTERNATIVE_IDS.description: A collection of alternative identification data for exchanges as recognized by various data platforms.

NAME.description: The name of the alternative data platform or identifier.

ID.description: The unique identifier associated with the exchange on the alternative platform.

CURRENTLY_IN_USE.description: Indicates whether this alternative ID is currently in use.

EXCHANGE_DESCRIPTION_SUMMARY.description: The short form description text only for this exchange.

EXCHANGE_DESCRIPTION_SNIPPET.description: The shortest form description text only for this exchange. This is a lot more limited than the summary. Generally this is a one or maximum two sentences.

OPTIONS_INTEGRATION_COMMENTS.description: Any internal comments for the options integration, this is used by both the order book team and the nodejs team.

instruments.description: The list of instruments requested. It could be a selected few or all for each market.

BTC-USD.description: All the relevant data for the particular mapped or unmapped instrument id.

TYPE.description: Type of the message. This is used to be able to validate the fields and to give an indication of what data to expect in the rest of the object / array

INSTRUMENT_STATUS.description: Status of the current instrument, this is ACTIVE, RETIRED or EXPIRED.

INSTRUMENT.description: The internal exchange defined instrument id. This will be different from integration to integration as each exchange has different naming conventions.

HISTO_SHARD.description: Our internal shard for historical OHLCV+ (minute/hour/day) market data. Minute data is only held in the historical database for up to 3 weeks and we ship it to blob storage afterwards. The API utilizes multiple replicas of a single shard in a round-robin manner.

INSTRUMENT_MAPPING.description: The current mapping object for this instrument.

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The current mapping instrument id.

TRANSFORM_FUNCTION.description: The current mapping function for this instrument. For example, during mapping, instruments may be inverted when they originally trade from a less dominant to a more dominant pair. For instance, USD-BTC would use the function INVERT and be represented as BTC-USD.

INDEX_UNDERLYING.description: The underlying instrument for the index. This can be used with the index endpoint to retrieve values and additional information. This symbol may change if the asset undergoes a rebrand or if a more dominant asset starts trading under the same symbol.

QUOTE_CURRENCY.description: The asset in which the contract is priced.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY.description: The currency used to calculate the contract's PnL. The settlement currency may differ from the index's underlying or quote currencies. This symbol may change if the asset undergoes a rebrand or if a more dominant asset starts trading under the same symbol.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY.description: The asset in which the CONTRACT_SIZE is denominated. This symbol may change if the asset undergoes a rebrand or if a more dominant asset starts trading under the same symbol.

STRIKE_CURRENCY.description: The asset used as the strike for the contract's underlying index.

INDEX_UNDERLYING_ID.description: Represents the internal underlying asset ID of the index. This ID is static and will never change.

QUOTE_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal asset ID that the contract is priced in. This ID is static and will never change.

SETTLEMENT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal asset ID used to calculate contract PnL. The settlement asset can be different from the index underlying or quote currencies. This ID is static and will never change.

CONTRACT_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal asset ID of the denomination of the CONTRACT_SIZE. This ID is static and will never change.

STRIKE_CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal ID of the denomination of the CONTRACT_SIZE. This ID is static and will never change.

CREATED_ON.description: The timestamp indicating when this mapping was created.

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The mapped instrument ID (it depends on the instrument type, for spot it is just BASE-QUOTE).

HAS_TRADES_OPTIONS.description: A boolean flag indicating whether the instrument has options trades or not.

HAS_OPEN_INTEREST_OPTIONS_UPDATES.description: A boolean flag indicating whether the instrument has options open interest updates or not.

FIRST_TRADE_OPTIONS_TIMESTAMP.description: The Unix timestamp of the first observed options trade for this instrument. This timestamp represents the earliest options trade recorded. Rare updates may occur, and backfilled data can take up to 1 hour to reflect on the API.

FIRST_OPEN_INTEREST_OPTIONS_UPDATE_TIMES.description: The Unix timestamp of the first observed options open interest update for this instrument. This represents the earliest recorded value for open interest. Updates are rare and backfilled data may take up to 1 hour to appear on the API.

LAST_TRADE_OPTIONS_TIMESTAMP.description: The Unix timestamp of the last options trade observed for this instrument. This timestamp represents when the most recent options trade was recorded in our system. Data may be delayed by up to 1 hour and is indicative only. For real-time data, consult the latest tick endpoint or use this timestamp in the after_ts parameter of the options trades by timestamp endpoint.

LAST_OPEN_INTEREST_OPTIONS_UPDATE_TIMEST.description: The Unix timestamp of the last options open interest update observed for this instrument. This timestamp represents when the most recent options open interest update was recorded in our system. Data may be delayed by up to 1 hour and is indicative only. For real-time data, consult the latest tick endpoint or use this timestamp in the after_ts parameter of the options open interest updates by timestamp endpoint.

TOTAL_TRADES_OPTIONS.description: The total number of options trades processed for this instrument by this specific exchange. This represents the cumulative updates handled by our system.

TOTAL_OPEN_INTEREST_OPTIONS_UPDATES.description: The total number of options open interest updates processed for this instrument by this specific exchange. This represents the cumulative updates handled by our system.

CONTRACT_EXPIRATION_TS.description: The contract expiration timestamp we get for the specific derivative instrument. Not needed for PERPETUAL contract types.

MARKET.description: The market / exchange you have requested (name of the market / exchange e.g. coinbase, kraken, etc.)

INSTRUMENT.description: The unmapped instrument ID

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The mapped instrument ID, derived from our mapping rules. Only available on instruments that have been mapped.

CURRENCY.description: The mapped index currency, e.g. BTC. Only available on instruments that have been mapped.

CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the mapped index currency, e.g. 1. This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

TRANSFORM_FUNCTION.description: The transform function. This is the function we apply when we do mapping to change values into easier human readable ones and to make sure the mapped direction BASE - QUOTE is constant accross all instruments.

CCSEQ.description: Our internal sequence number for this tick update, this is unique per market / exchange and trading pair / instrument. It will always be increasing by 1 for each new tick update we send.

VALUE.description: The value of the index.

VALUE_FLAG.description: The flag indicating if the value has increased, decreased, or not changed

VALUE_LAST_UPDATE_TS.description: The timestamp in seconds as reported by the market / exchange or the received timestamp if the market / exchange does not provide one of the last update that had an impact on the value.

VALUE_LAST_UPDATE_TS_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the timestamp as reported by the market / exchange or the nanosecond part of the received timestamp if the market / exchange does not provide one of the last update that had an impact on the value.

LAST_UPDATE_ID.description: The ID of the last message update

LAST_UPDATE_CCSEQ.description: The CCSEQ of the last message update

CURRENT_HOUR_OPEN.description: The open value for the current hour, this is based on the closest update before the start of the current hour.

CURRENT_HOUR_HIGH.description: The highest value between the open and the highest update value in the current hour. The same as open when there no update in the time period.

CURRENT_HOUR_LOW.description: The lowest value between the open and the lowest update value in the current hour. The same as open when there no update in the time period.

CURRENT_HOUR_TOTAL_INDEX_UPDATES.description: The total updates since the start of the current hour.

CURRENT_HOUR_CHANGE.description: The value change from the CURRENT_HOUR. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_HOUR_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the CURRENT_HOUR. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

CURRENT_DAY_OPEN.description: The open value for the current day, this is based on the closest update before the start of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC).

CURRENT_DAY_HIGH.description: The highest value between the open and the highest update value in the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC). The same as open when there no updates in the time period.

CURRENT_DAY_LOW.description: The lowest value between the open and the lowest update value in the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC). The same as open when there no updates in the time period.

CURRENT_DAY_TOTAL_INDEX_UPDATES.description: The total updates since the start of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC).

CURRENT_DAY_CHANGE.description: The value change from the CURRENT_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the CURRENT_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

CURRENT_WEEK_OPEN.description: The value of the closest update to Monday (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of this week. This would be, in a highly liquid market, the last update that happened on the previous Sunday at (23:59:59 999 GMT/UTC). This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full weekly value.

CURRENT_WEEK_HIGH.description: The highest value between the CURRENT_WEEK_OPEN and the highest update value of the week excluding the current day (Monday - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the week). If today is Monday, this value will be CURRENT_WEEK_OPEN.

CURRENT_WEEK_LOW.description: The lowest value between the CURRENT_WEEK_OPEN and the lowest update value of the week excluding the current day (Monday - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the week). If today is Monday, this value will be CURRENT_WEEK_OPEN.

CURRENT_WEEK_TOTAL_INDEX_UPDATES.description: The total count of updates between Monday (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the week. If today is Monday, this value will be 0.

CURRENT_WEEK_CHANGE.description: The value change from the CURRENT_WEEK. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_WEEK_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the CURRENT_WEEK. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

CURRENT_MONTH_OPEN.description: The value of the closest update to the 1st day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of this month. This would be, in a highly liquid market, the last update that happened on the previous month at (23:59:59 999 GMT/UTC). This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full monthly value.

CURRENT_MONTH_HIGH.description: The highest value between the CURRENT_MONTH_OPEN and the highest update value of the month excluding the current day (1st of the month - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the month). If today is the 1st of the month, this value will be CURRENT_MONTH_OPEN.

CURRENT_MONTH_LOW.description: The lowest value between the CURRENT_MONTH_OPEN and the lowest update value of the month excluding the current day (1st of the month - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the month). If today is the 1st of the month, this value will be CURRENT_MONTH_OPEN.

CURRENT_MONTH_TOTAL_INDEX_UPDATES.description: The total count of trades between 1st of the month (xxxx:xx:01 00:00:00 GMT/UTC) and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the month. If today is 1st of the month, this value will be 0.

CURRENT_MONTH_CHANGE.description: The value change from the CURRENT_MONTH. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_MONTH_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the CURRENT_MONTH. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

CURRENT_YEAR_OPEN.description: The value of the closest trade to the 1st of January (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of this year. This would be, in a highly liquid market, the last update that happened on on the 31st of December of the previous year (23:59:59 999 GMT/UTC). This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full yearly value.

CURRENT_YEAR_HIGH.description: The highest value between the CURRENT_YEAR_OPEN and the highest update value of the year excluding the current day (1st of January - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the year). If today is the 1st of January, this value will be CURRENT_YEAR_OPEN.

CURRENT_YEAR_LOW.description: The lowest value between the CURRENT_YEAR_OPEN and the lowest update value of the year excluding the current day (1st of January - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the year). If today is the 1st of January, this value will be CURRENT_YEAR_OPEN.

CURRENT_YEAR_TOTAL_INDEX_UPDATES.description: The total count of updates between 1st of January (xxxx:01:01 00:00:00 GMT/UTC) and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the year. If today is 1st of January, this value will be 0.

CURRENT_YEAR_CHANGE.description: The value change from the CURRENT_YEAR. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_YEAR_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the CURRENT_YEAR. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

MOVING_24_HOUR_OPEN.description: The value of the closest update to the period start date (23 hours + current hour ago). This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full 24 hour value.

MOVING_24_HOUR_HIGH.description: The highest value between the MOVING_24_HOUR_OPEN and the highest update value of the period - from 24 hours ago up to the beginning of the current hour (23 hours in total).

MOVING_24_HOUR_LOW.description: The lowest value between the MOVING_24_HOUR_OPEN and the lowest update value of the period - from 24 hours ago up to the beginning of the current hour (23 hours in total).

MOVING_24_HOUR_TOTAL_INDEX_UPDATES.description: The total count of updates between 24 hours ago and the beginning (xx:00:00) of the current hour (23 hours in total).

MOVING_24_HOUR_CHANGE.description: The value change from the MOVING_24_HOUR. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

MOVING_24_HOUR_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the MOVING_24_HOUR. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

MOVING_7_DAY_OPEN.description: The value of the closest update to the period start date (6 days + current day - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to now).  This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full 7 day value.

MOVING_7_DAY_HIGH.description: The highest value between the MOVING_7_DAY_OPEN and the highest update value of the period - from 7 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (6 days in total).

MOVING_7_DAY_LOW.description: The lowest value between the MOVING_7_DAY_OPEN and the lowest update value of the period - from 7 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (6 days in total).

MOVING_7_DAY_TOTAL_INDEX_UPDATES.description: The total count of updates between 7 days ago and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day (6 days in total).

MOVING_7_DAY_CHANGE.description: The value change from the MOVING_7_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

MOVING_7_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the MOVING_7_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

MOVING_30_DAY_OPEN.description: The value of the closest update to the period start date (29 days + current day - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to now).  This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full 30 day value.

MOVING_30_DAY_HIGH.description: The highest value between the MOVING_30_DAY_OPEN and the highest update value of the period - from 30 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (29 days in total).

MOVING_30_DAY_LOW.description: The lowest value between the MOVING_30_DAY_OPEN and the lowest update value of the period - from 30 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (29 days in total).

MOVING_30_DAY_TOTAL_INDEX_UPDATES.description: The total count of updates between 30 days ago and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day (29 days in total).

MOVING_30_DAY_CHANGE.description: The value change from the MOVING_30_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

MOVING_30_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the MOVING_30_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

MOVING_90_DAY_OPEN.description: The value of the closest update to the period start date (89 days + current day - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to now).  This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full 90 day value.

MOVING_90_DAY_HIGH.description: The highest value between the MOVING_90_DAY_OPEN and the highest update value of the period - from 90 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (89 days in total).

MOVING_90_DAY_LOW.description: The lowest value between the MOVING_90_DAY_OPEN and the lowest update value of the period - from 90 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (89 days in total).

MOVING_90_DAY_TOTAL_INDEX_UPDATES.description: The total count of updates between 90 days ago and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day (89 days in total). To get the total 90 day value add CURRENT_DAY_TOTAL_INDEX_UPDATES to this value.

MOVING_90_DAY_CHANGE.description: The value change from the MOVING_90_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

MOVING_90_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the MOVING_90_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

MOVING_180_DAY_OPEN.description: The value of the closest update to the period start date (179 days + current day - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to now).  This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full 180 day value.

MOVING_180_DAY_HIGH.description: The highest value between the MOVING_180_DAY_OPEN and the highest update value of the period - from 180 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (179 days in total).

MOVING_180_DAY_LOW.description: The lowest value between the MOVING_180_DAY_OPEN and the lowest update value of the period - from 180 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (179 days in total).

MOVING_180_DAY_TOTAL_INDEX_UPDATES.description: The total count of updates between 180 days ago and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day (179 days in total).

MOVING_180_DAY_CHANGE.description: The value change from the MOVING_180_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

MOVING_180_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the MOVING_180_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

MOVING_365_DAY_OPEN.description: The value of the closest update to the period start date (364 days + current day - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to now).  This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full 365 day value.

MOVING_365_DAY_HIGH.description: The highest value between the MOVING_365_DAY_OPEN and the highest update value of the period - from 365 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (364 days in total).

MOVING_365_DAY_LOW.description: The lowest value between the MOVING_365_DAY_OPEN and the lowest update value of the period - from 365 days ago up to the beginning of the current day (364 days in total).

MOVING_365_DAY_TOTAL_INDEX_UPDATES.description: The total count of updates between 365 days ago and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day (364 days in total).

LIFETIME_FIRST_UPDATE_TS.description: The timestamp of the first update we have ever seen on the instrument

LIFETIME_OPEN.description: The value of the first update of the instrument.

LIFETIME_HIGH.description: The value of the highest update ever executed on this instrument.

LIFETIME_HIGH_TS.description: The the timestamp of the highest update ever executed on this instrument.

LIFETIME_LOW.description: The value of the lowest update ever executed on this instrument.

LIFETIME_LOW_TS.description: The timestamp of the lowest update ever executed on this instrument.

LIFETIME_TOTAL_INDEX_UPDATES.description: The total count of all updates that have ever been executed on this instrument.

LIFETIME_CHANGE.description: The value change from the LIFETIME. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

LIFETIME_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the LIFETIME. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

Err.description: This object provides detailed information about an error encountered while processing the request. It includes an error code, a message explaining the error, and additional context about the parameters or values that caused the issue. This helps clients identify and resolve issues with their requests.

type.description: A public facing error type. If you want to treat a specific error use the type.

message.example: Not found: market parameter. Value test_market_does_not_exist not integrated yet. We list all markets in lowercase and transform the parameter sent, make sure you check the https://data-api.cryptocompare.com/spot/v1/markets endpoint for a list of all the supported TRADE_SPOT markets

param.description: The parameter that is responsible for the error

values.description: The values responsible for the error

UNIT.description: The unit of the historical period update: MINUTE for minute, HOUR for hour and DAY for day.

TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds of the histo period, for minute it would be every minute at the beginning of the minute, for hour it would be start of the hour and for daily it is 00:00 GMT/UTC

MARKET.description: The market / exchange you have requested (name of the market / exchange e.g. bitmex, deribit, ftx, etc.)

INSTRUMENT.description: The unmapped instrument ID

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The instrument ID, as derived from our mapping rules. Only available on instruments that have been mapped.

CURRENCY.description: The mapped index currency. Only available on instruments that have mapping.

CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the mapped index currency, e.g. 1. This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

TRANSFORM_FUNCTION.description: The transform function. This is the function we apply when we do mapping to change values into easier human readable ones and to make sure the mapped direction BASE - QUOTE is constant accross all instruments.

OPEN.description: The open value for the historical period, this is based on the closest index update before the period start

HIGH.description: The max between the open and the highest index update value in this time period (same as open when there no messages in the time period).

LOW.description: The min between the open and the lowest index update value in this time period (same as open when there no messages in the time period).

CLOSE.description: The value of the last index update in this time period (same as open when there no messages in the time period).

FIRST_MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds of the first index update in this time period (only available when we have at least one index update in the time period).

LAST_MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds of the last index update in this time period (only available when we have at least one index update in the time period).

FIRST_MESSAGE_VALUE.description: The open based on the first index update in the time period (only available when we have at least one index update in the time period).

HIGH_MESSAGE_VALUE.description: The highest value of the messages in the time period (only available when we have at least one index update in the time period).

HIGH_MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds of the highest index update in this time period (only available when we have at least one index update in the time period).

LOW_MESSAGE_VALUE.description: The lowest value of the messages in the time period (only available when we have at least one index update in the time period).

LOW_MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds of the lowest index update in this time period (only available when we have at least one index update in the time period).

LAST_MESSAGE_VALUE.description: The last index update value in the time period (only available when we have at least one index update in the time period).

TOTAL_INDEX_UPDATES.description: The total number of message updates seen in this time period (0 when there no messages in the time period).

MARKET.description: The market / exchange or index code you have requested (name of the market / exchange e.g. Coinbase, Kraken, etc.)

INSTRUMENT.description: The original unmapped instrument ID as provided by the exchange or generated internally by us for an index, which can have various formats (e.g., BTC-USD, BTCUSD, BTC_USD, XBT-ZUSD).

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The mapped instrument ID after applying our mapping rules. This takes the form: "BASE-QUOTE" and is available only for instruments that have been mapped (e.g. BTC-USD).

CURRENCY.description: The mapped index currency. Only available on instruments that have been mapped (e.g. BTC).

CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the mapped index currency, e.g. 1. This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

TRANSFORM_FUNCTION.description: The transform function. This is the function we apply when we do mapping to change values into easier human readable ones and to make sure the mapped direction BASE - QUOTE is constant accross all instruments.

ID.description: The index id as reported by the market / exchange or the timestamp in seconds / millisconds / nanoseconds depending on the index dissemination frequency.

TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds as reported by the market / exchange or the received timestamp if the market / exchange does not provide one.

TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the reported timestamp

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds when we received the index value. This varies from a few millisconds from the index value taking place on the market / exchange to a few seconds depending on the market / exchange API options / rate limits

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the received timestamp, only available for a subset of markets / exchanges

VALUE.description: The value of the index

SOURCE.description: The source of the index update: POLLING, STREAMING, GO, BLOB etc.

CCSEQ.description: Our internal sequence number for this index update, this is unique per market / exchange and instrument. Should always be increasing by 1 for each new trade we discover, not in chronological order.

STATUS.description: The status of the update.

Data.description: An array containing valid and invalid index updates for the requested time period. Index updates are ordered by CCSEQ, which generally reflects the order of their calculation. Any backfilled index updates that are added later will appear at the end of the array. This ensures a reliable and sequential view of index updates data, including historical corrections. If an index update was initially deemed valid but later determined to have been sent in error or processed incorrectly the STATUS field will be changed to reflect this. We retain invalid index updates to maintain the continuity of CCSEQ and ensure there are no gaps in the sequence. You can elimiate invalid index updates from the response by setting the skip_invalid_messages paramater to true, keep in mind that by doing this you will have gaps in the CCSEQ of each index update and you can no longer easily guarantee you have received all the index updates.

MARKET.description: The market / exchange or index code you have requested (name of the market / exchange e.g. Coinbase, Kraken, etc.)

INSTRUMENT.description: The original unmapped instrument ID as provided by the exchange or generated internally by us for an index, which can have various formats (e.g., BTC-USD, BTCUSD, BTC_USD, XBT-ZUSD).

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The mapped instrument ID after applying our mapping rules. This takes the form: "BASE-QUOTE" and is available only for instruments that have been mapped (e.g. BTC-USD).

CURRENCY.description: The mapped index currency. Only available on instruments that have been mapped (e.g. BTC).

CURRENCY_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the mapped index currency, e.g. 1. This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

TRANSFORM_FUNCTION.description: The transform function. This is the function we apply when we do mapping to change values into easier human readable ones and to make sure the mapped direction BASE - QUOTE is constant accross all instruments.

ID.description: The index id as reported by the market / exchange or the timestamp in seconds / millisconds / nanoseconds depending on the index dissemination frequency.

TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds as reported by the market / exchange or the received timestamp if the market / exchange does not provide one.

TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the reported timestamp

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds when we received the index value. This varies from a few millisconds from the index value taking place on the market / exchange to a few seconds depending on the market / exchange API options / rate limits

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the received timestamp, only available for a subset of markets / exchanges

VALUE.description: The value of the index

SOURCE.description: The source of the index update: POLLING, STREAMING, GO, BLOB etc.

CCSEQ.description: Our internal sequence number for this index update, this is unique per market / exchange and instrument. Should always be increasing by 1 for each new trade we discover, not in chronological order.

STATUS.description: The status of the update.

Data.description: An array containing valid index updates for the requested time period. Index updates are ordered by CCSEQ, which generally reflects the order of their calculation timestamps. Any backfilled index updates that are added later will appear at the end of the array. This ensures a reliable and sequential view of index update data, including historical corrections. If an index update was initially deemed valid but later determined to have been sent in error or processed incorrectly, it is removed from this array and added to the "Invalid" array. We retain invalid index updates in a separate array to maintain the continuity of CCSEQ and ensure there are no gaps in the sequence.

METADATA_VERSION.description: The version of metadata, used for version conversions/migrates.

INSTRUMENT_STATUS.description: The status of the instrument, we only poll / stream / connect to the ACTIVE ones, for the RETIRED / IGNORED / EXPIRED / READY_FOR_DECOMMISSIONING means we no longer query/stream data.

INSTRUMENT.description: The instrument ID as it is on the exchange with small modifications - we do not allow the following characters inside isntrument ids: ,/&?

INSTRUMENT_MAPPING.description: The current mapping information for this instrument

INSTRUMENT_EXTERNAL_DATA.description: The full data we get from the polling endpoint for this specific instrument. This is a JSON stringified object with different properties per exchange.

INSTRUMENT_AVAILABLE_ON_INSTRUMENTS_ENDP.description: This flags the exchange instrument is currently available on instruments endpoint.

INDEX_UNDERLYING.description: The underlying instrument of the index.

TICK_SIZE.description: The minimum amount the price can move, denominated in QUOTE_CURRENCY

ARCHIVE_STATUS.description: The archive status of the instrument

HOST_MIGRATION_STATUS.description: The migration status of the symbol, we only poll / stream / connect empty or SETTLED

INSTRUMENT_INDEX_UPDATE_REST_URI.description: This is used to build up the request in some cases, this is where we put the id we use when querying for INDEX_UPDATE.

INSTRUMENT_INDEX_UPDATE_REST_URL.description: The URL we send to the proxy swarm to get INDEX_UPDATE for the instrument.

INSTRUMENT_INDEX_UPDATE_STREAMING_SUBSCR.description: This is used to build up the subscription in some cases, this is where we put the id we use when subscribing for INDEX_UPDATE on this instrument.

INSTRUMENT_INDEX_UPDATE_IS_READY_FOR_STR.description: This flags the exchange instrument as in ready to consume INDEX_UPDATE via a streaming integration.

LAST_CONCURRENT_BATCH_OF_INDEX_UPDATES_M.description: The timestamp last encountered where the batch of trades from INDEX_UPDATES all occured at the same time. This is an issue when making the next request that requires polling by timestamp as a start/from parameter

INSTRUMENT_INDEX_UPDATE_FROM_POLLING_RES.description: The last time we received a request from the proxy swarm with INDEX_UPDATE for this instrument.
