LAST_INDEX_UPDATE_FROM_FIX.description: This is the last INDEX_UPDATE that we have seen on the specific source type in internal format.

FIRST_INDEX_UPDATE_FROM_FIX_EXTERNAL.description: This is the first INDEX_UPDATE that we have seen on the specific source type in external format.

LAST_INDEX_UPDATE_FROM_FIX_EXTERNAL.description: This is the last INDEX_UPDATE that we have seen on the specific trade source in external format.

UNSTRUCTURED_INDEX_UPDATE_FROM_FIX_INTER.description: This is any extra helper INDEX_UPDATE data that we would need for creating polling requests or subscribing with non standard information and anything that is very specific to one exchange API/Integration and it does not fit any of the other existing fields and is definitly only updated or written in only one service.

FIRST_INDEX_UPDATE_FROM_EOD.description: This is the first INDEX_UPDATE that we have seen on the specific source type in internal format.

LAST_INDEX_UPDATE_FROM_EOD.description: This is the last INDEX_UPDATE that we have seen on the specific source type in internal format.

FIRST_INDEX_UPDATE_FROM_EOD_EXTERNAL.description: This is the first INDEX_UPDATE that we have seen on the specific source type in external format.

LAST_INDEX_UPDATE_FROM_EOD_EXTERNAL.description: This is the last INDEX_UPDATE that we have seen on the specific trade source in external format.

UNSTRUCTURED_INDEX_UPDATE_FROM_EOD_INTER.description: This is any extra helper INDEX_UPDATE data that we would need for creating polling requests or subscribing with non standard information and anything that is very specific to one exchange API/Integration and it does not fit any of the other existing fields and is definitly only updated or written in only one service.

INSTRUMENT_SOURCE_POLLING.description: Where do we get the instrument id / INSTRUMENT_{messageName}_REST_URI / INSTRUMENT_{messageName}_STREAMING_SUBSCRIPTION etc from.

INSTRUMENT_SOURCE_STREAMING.description: Where do we get the instrument id / INSTRUMENT_{messageName}_REST_URI / INSTRUMENT_{messageName}_STREAMING_SUBSCRIPTION etc from.

INSTRUMENT_SOURCE_GO.description: Where do we get the instrument id / INSTRUMENT_{messageName}_REST_URI / INSTRUMENT_{messageName}_STREAMING_SUBSCRIPTION etc from.

INSTRUMENT_SOURCE_BLOB.description: Where do we get the instrument id / INSTRUMENT_{messageName}_REST_URI / INSTRUMENT_{messageName}_STREAMING_SUBSCRIPTION etc from.

INSTRUMENT_SOURCE_CALCULATED.description: Where do we get the instrument id / INSTRUMENT_{messageName}_REST_URI / INSTRUMENT_{messageName}_STREAMING_SUBSCRIPTION etc from.

INSTRUMENT_SOURCE_BACKFILL.description: Where do we get the instrument id / INSTRUMENT_{messageName}_REST_URI / INSTRUMENT_{messageName}_STREAMING_SUBSCRIPTION etc from.

INSTRUMENT_SOURCE_FIX.description: Where do we get the instrument id / INSTRUMENT_{messageName}_REST_URI / INSTRUMENT_{messageName}_STREAMING_SUBSCRIPTION etc from.

INSTRUMENT_SOURCE_EOD.description: Where do we get the instrument id / INSTRUMENT_{messageName}_REST_URI / INSTRUMENT_{messageName}_STREAMING_SUBSCRIPTION etc from.

FIRST_SEEN_ON_POLLING_TS.description: This is the first time instrument was seen on instrumentListSourceType POLLING.

LAST_SEEN_ON_POLLING_TS.description: This is the last time instrument was seen on instrumentListSourceType POLLING.

FIRST_SEEN_ON_STREAMING_TS.description: This is the first time instrument was seen on instrumentListSourceType STREAMING.

LAST_SEEN_ON_STREAMING_TS.description: This is the last time instrument was seen on instrumentListSourceType STREAMING.

FIRST_SEEN_ON_NSQ_TS.description: This is the first time instrument was seen on instrumentListSourceType NSQ.

LAST_SEEN_ON_NSQ_TS.description: This is the last time instrument was seen on instrumentListSourceType NSQ.

FIRST_SEEN_ON_BLOB_TS.description: This is the first time instrument was seen on instrumentListSourceType BLOB.

LAST_SEEN_ON_BLOB_TS.description: This is the last time instrument was seen on instrumentListSourceType BLOB.

FIRST_SEEN_ON_HARDCODED_TS.description: This is the first time instrument was seen on instrumentListSourceType HARDCODED.

LAST_SEEN_ON_HARDCODED_TS.description: This is the last time instrument was seen on instrumentListSourceType HARDCODED.

FIRST_SEEN_ON_INDEX_COMPOSITION_TS.description: This is the first time instrument was seen on instrumentListSourceType INDEX_COMPOSITION.

LAST_SEEN_ON_INDEX_COMPOSITION_TS.description: This is the last time instrument was seen on instrumentListSourceType INDEX_COMPOSITION.

FIRST_SEEN_ON_FIX_TS.description: This is the first time instrument was seen on instrumentListSourceType FIX.

LAST_SEEN_ON_FIX_TS.description: This is the last time instrument was seen on instrumentListSourceType FIX.

FIRST_SEEN_ON_BACKFILL_TS.description: This is the first time instrument was seen on instrumentListSourceType BACKFILL.

LAST_SEEN_ON_BACKFILL_TS.description: This is the last time instrument was seen on instrumentListSourceType BACKFILL.

FIRST_SEEN_ON_EOD_CONFIG_TS.description: This is the first time instrument was seen on instrumentListSourceType EOD_CONFIG.

LAST_SEEN_ON_EOD_CONFIG_TS.description: This is the last time instrument was seen on instrumentListSourceType EOD_CONFIG.

Err.description: This object provides detailed information about an error encountered while processing the request. It includes an error code, a message explaining the error, and additional context about the parameters or values that caused the issue. This helps clients identify and resolve issues with their requests.

type.description: A public facing error type. If you want to treat a specific error use the type.

message.example: Not found: market parameter. Value test_market_does_not_exist not integrated yet. We list all markets in lowercase and transform the parameter sent, make sure you check the https://data-api.cryptocompare.com/spot/v1/markets endpoint for a list of all the supported TRADE_SPOT markets

param.description: The parameter that is responsible for the error

values.description: The values responsible for the error

EXCHANGE_STATUS.description: The status of the exchange. We only poll / stream / connect to the ACTIVE ones, for the RETIRED ones we no longer query for data

MAPPED_INSTRUMENTS_TOTAL.description: The total number of instruments that have been verified by our mapping team and have been properly assigned with a base, quote, mapping function, and other necessary fields. This is done to ensure that pairs like XXBTZUSD are accurately mapped to BTC-USD and that the pair refers to the correct assets rather than using the same asset id to represent different assets.

UNMAPPED_INSTRUMENTS_TOTAL.description: The number of instruments that have not yet been verified by our mapping team.

INSTRUMENT_STATUS.description: An object with the total number of instrument for each of the available instrument statuses.

ACTIVE.description: The total number of instruments currently available on the market, which are considered active. An active instrument is defined as an instrument from which we retrieve data and have either already mapped or are planning to map.

IGNORED.description: The total number of instruments available on the market that are classified as ignored, meaning that we do not plan to map them. Ignored instruments are those from which we do retrieve data but do not have any intention to map.

RETIRED.description: The total number of instruments that are classified as retired, meaning that they are no longer actively traded on the market. These instruments have ceased trading, and as such, we do not retrieve data from them but we have mapped them already.

EXPIRED.description: The total number of instruments that are classified as expired, meaning that they are mapped instruments that are no longer actively traded on the market. These expired instruments are typically futures or options instruments that have reached their expiration date and are no longer available for trading. While we have previously mapped these instruments, we do not retrieve any data from them since they are no longer actively traded.

ID.description: The unique identifier for the exchange entry

EXCHANGE_INTERNAL_NAME.description: Internal mapped name for a specific exchange

URI.description: The uri path that this exchange will be found on / url-slug

COMMENT.description: Any internal comments you might have for this exchange

IS_PUBLIC.description: This is flagged to false when exchanges are deleted/hidden

ASSIGNED_TO.description: Internal user id of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the exchange

ASSIGNED_TO_USERNAME.description: Internal username of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the exchange at the time of the exchange assignment (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

CREATED_ON.description: Exchange internal creation unix ts in our system

CREATED_BY.description: Internal user id of the user who created the exchange

CREATED_BY_USERNAME.description: Internal username of the user who created the exchange at the time of the exchange creation (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

UPDATED_ON.description: Exchange internal last updated unix ts in our system

UPDATED_BY.description: Internal user id of the user who last updated the exchange

UPDATED_BY_USERNAME.description: Internal username of the user who last updated the internal information of the exchange at the time of the exchange update (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

ASSIGNED_TO_INTEGRATION_MAIN.description: Internal user id of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the exchange integration

ASSIGNED_TO_USERNAME_INTEGRATION_MAIN.description: Internal username of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the exchange integration at the time of the exchange assignment (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

ASSIGNED_TO_INTEGRATION_BACKUP.description: Internal user id of the user who is the backup for updating and maintaining the exchange integration

ASSIGNED_TO_USERNAME_INTEGRATION_BACKUP.description: Internal username of the user who is the backup for maintaining the exchange integration at the time of the exchange assignment (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

ASSIGNED_TO_BUSINESS_OR_CONTRACT.description: Internal user id of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the exchange contract data

ASSIGNED_TO_USERNAME_BUSINESS_OR_CONTRAC.description: Internal username of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the exchange contract data at the time of the exchange assignment (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

PUBLIC_NOTICE.description: A public notice for this exchange.

EXCHANGE_SUSPENSION_REASON.description: This specifies the underlying cause leading to the suspension of trading activities on the exchange. This information is critical for transparency and assists in the decision-making process for users and stakeholders. Selecting an option from this dropdown provides clarity on the nature of the suspension, whether it's temporary or permanent.

TRADING_PERMANENTLY_SUSPENDED_DATE.description: The retire date of the exchange is indicated as (yyyy-mm-dd).

NAME.description: The full name of the exchange, e.g. Coinbase.

LAUNCH_DATE.description: The launch date of the exchange is indicated as (yyyy-mm-dd).

IS_EXCLUDED_FROM_METRICS_AND_TOPLISTS.description: Indicates whether the exchange instruments should be excluded from the overall volumes and asset markets toplist. Basically exclude it from all aggregations.

HAS_SPOT_TRADING.description: This is set to true if is a centralized exchange and it offers spot trading.

HAS_FUTURES_TRADING.description: This is set to true if is a centralized exchange and it offers futures trading.

HAS_INDEX_PUBLISHING.description: This is set to true if is a centralized exchange and it offers index publishing.

HAS_OPTIONS_TRADING.description: This is set to true if is a centralized exchange and it offers options trading.

HAS_DEX_TRADING.description: This is set to true if is a decentralized exchange and it offers spot trading that is based on automated market making smart contract.

WEBSITE_URL.description: The link for the official exchange website.

BLOG_URL.description: The link for the official blog.

INCORPORATION_DOCUMENT_URL.description: The URL providing access to the projectâ€™s incorporation documents. These documents offer legal information about the companyâ€™s establishment and its legal standing.

OTHER_DOCUMENT_URLS.description: Other documents that might be relevant to the exchange, they should all be PDFs.

TYPE.description: The category of document being uploaded.

VERSION.description: The version number of the document if applicable.

URL.description: Upload the PDF document containing point-in-time information captured from the exchange.

ORIGINAL_SOURCE_URL.description: The original URL on the exchange website where this document was found or downloaded from.

COMMENT.description: Additional notes or context about the document.

EXCHANGE_CERTIFICATIONS.description: Defines the specific certifications or accreditations that an exchange has obtained.

NAME.description: The name of the certification or accreditation

ID.description: The certification id.

URL.description: The URL of cerification document if there is one.

SUPPORT_CONTACT_INFORMATION.description: Various channels through which customers can reach out to the exchange for support.

DETAILS.description: Specific details like email address, phone number, URL, etc., for the selected contact medium.

COMMENTS.description: Any additional comments or notes regarding the support contact.

CONTROLLED_ADDRESSES.description: The list of designated addresses used to manage and store assets within an investment portfolio or on behalf of clients. This includes addresses where cryptocurrencies, securities, or other assets are held, reflecting the diverse nature of modern investment strategies. It encompasses addresses used by exchanges, ETFs, and companies to maintain their investment reserves or operational funds.

BLOCKCHAIN.description: The is linked to the asset representing a specific chain.

ADDRESS.description: The address of the smart contracts, external user accounts or other account

ADDRESS_PURPOSE.description: The role of the address within the company's operations, aiding in precise asset management and regulatory compliance. This categorization distinguishes between addresses for investments, client custody, and operational expenses, streamlining asset control and reporting.

CONTROL_TYPE.description: Classifies the level and nature of control the company exercises over various cryptocurrency addresses. This categorization helps delineate the operational and security protocols associated with each address, ranging from single-key direct control to multi-signatory arrangements and even non-control strategies.

NAME.description: The name of the address. Contract name or just the common name for this address.

DESCRIPTION.description: A description for the address.

IS_INCLUDED_IN_CADLI.description: Indicates whether the asset is part of the CADLI index, which calculates the price of an asset in USD. This field is crucial for tracking asset inclusion in CADLI, aiding in data analysis and decision-making processes related to asset pricing.

EXCHANGE_ALTERNATIVE_IDS.description: A collection of alternative identification data for exchanges as recognized by various data platforms.

NAME.description: The name of the alternative data platform or identifier.

ID.description: The unique identifier associated with the exchange on the alternative platform.

CURRENTLY_IN_USE.description: Indicates whether this alternative ID is currently in use.

EXCHANGE_DESCRIPTION.description: The long form description in markdown for this exchange.

EXCHANGE_DESCRIPTION_SUMMARY.description: The short form description text only for this exchange.

EXCHANGE_DESCRIPTION_SNIPPET.description: The shortest form description text only for this exchange. This is a lot more limited than the summary. Generally this is a one or maximum two sentences.

IS_HIDDEN.description: Indicates whether the exchange is hidden.

TYPE.description: The type of message this is. It helps identify the nature of the data being returned.

MARKET.description: The market / exchange under consideration (e.g. coinbase, kraken, etc).

INSTRUMENT.description: The unmapped instrument ID, this takes the form of the smart contract address and the chain ID it exists on separated by an underscore.

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The instrument id based on asset symbols, as derived from our mapping rules. This is the same as the INSTRUMENT and will not change.

BASE.description: Represents the base asset or coin symbol, commonly known as the ticker (e.g., BTC). This symbol may change in cases of asset rebranding. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

QUOTE.description: Represents the quote asset or counter coin symbol, commonly known as the ticker (e.g., USD). This symbol may change in cases of asset rebranding. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

BASE_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the base asset or coin (e.g., 1 for BTC). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

QUOTE_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the quote asset or counter coin (e.g., 5 for USD). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

TRANSFORM_FUNCTION.description: The transform function (or list of functions concatenated by _AND_). This is the function we apply when we do mapping to change values into easier human readable ones and to make sure the mapped direction BASE - QUOTE is constant accross all chains and instruments.

CCSEQ.description: Our internal sequence number for this tick update. This is unique per market / exchange and trading pair / instrument. It will always be increasing by 1 for each new tick update we send.

PRICE.description: The price in terms of the quote instrument of the swap. For a WETH-USDT swap, this is how much was swapped for one WETH in USDT.

PRICE_FLAG.description: The flag indicating whether the price has increased, decreased, or not changed

PRICE_LAST_UPDATE_TS.description: The timestamp in seconds as reported by the market / exchange. If the market /exchange does not provide this information, the received timestamp will be returned.

PRICE_LAST_UPDATE_TS_NS.description: The nanoseconds part of the timestamp as reported by the market / exchange. If the market /exchange does not provide this information, the nanoseconds part of the received timestamp will be returned.

PRICE_LAST_UPDATE_BLOCK_NUMBER.description: The block number as reported by the market / exchange. If the market /exchange does not provide this information, the received timestamp will be returned.

LAST_SWAP_QUANTITY.description: The quantity of the latest swap in the from symbol (base / coin).

LAST_SWAP_QUOTE_QUANTITY.description: The volume of the latest swap in the to asset / quote.

LAST_SWAP_ID.description: The ID of the latest swap.

LAST_SWAP_CCSEQ.description: The CCSEQ of the latest swap.

LAST_SWAP_SIDE.description: The side of the latest swap.

LAST_SWAP_TRANSACTION_HASH.description: The transaction hash of the latest swap.

LAST_SWAP_FROM.description: The from (sender) address of the latest swap.

LAST_PROCESSED_SWAP_TS.description: The timestamp in seconds that the last swap was processed, as reported by the market / exchange. If the market / exchange does not provide this information, the timestamp that the swap was received will be returned.

LAST_PROCESSED_SWAP_TS_NS.description: The nanoseconds part of the timestamp that the last swap was processed, as reported by the market / exchange. If the market / exchange does not provide this information, the nanoseconds part of the timestamp that the swap was received will be returned.

LAST_PROCESSED_SWAP_PRICE.description: The price in the quote asset of the last swap processed, as reported by the market / exchange.

LAST_PROCESSED_SWAP_QUANTITY.description: The quantity of the last processed swap in the from symbol (base / coin).

LAST_PROCESSED_SWAP_QUOTE_QUANTITY.description: The  volume of the last processed swap in the to asset / quote.

LAST_PROCESSED_SWAP_SIDE.description: The side of the last processed swap.

LAST_PROCESSED_SWAP_CCSEQ.description: The CCSEQ of the latest swap.

LAST_PROCESSED_SWAP_TRANSACTION_HASH.description: The transaction hash of the latest swap.

LAST_PROCESSED_SWAP_FROM.description: The from (sender) address of the latest swap.

CURRENT_HOUR_VOLUME.description: The sum of all swap quantities from the start of the current hour until now. Given in the base asset.

CURRENT_HOUR_VOLUME_BUY.description: The sum of all buy swap quantities from the start of the current hour until now. Given in the base asset.

CURRENT_HOUR_VOLUME_SELL.description: The sum of all sell swap quantities from the start of the current hour until now. Given in the base asset.

CURRENT_HOUR_VOLUME_UNKNOWN.description: The sum of all swap quote quantities from the start of the current hour until now. Given in the base asset.

CURRENT_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME.description: The sum of all swap quote quantities from the start of the current hour until now. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_BUY.description: The sum of all buy swap quote quantities from the start of the current hour until now. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_SELL.description: The sum of all sell swap quote quantities from the start of the current hour until now. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_UNKNOWN.description: The sum of all unknown swap quote quantities from the start of the current hour until now. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_HOUR_OPEN.description: The open price for the current hour, this is based on the closest swap occurring before the start of the current hour. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_HOUR_HIGH.description: The highest swap price of the current hour. If there were no updates in the time period, the open price will be given. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_HOUR_LOW.description: The lowest swap price of the current hour. If there were no updates in the time period, the open price will be given. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_HOUR_TOTAL_SWAPS.description: The total number of swap that have occurred since the start of the current hour.

CURRENT_HOUR_TOTAL_SWAPS_BUY.description: The total number of buy swap since the start of the current hour.

CURRENT_HOUR_TOTAL_SWAPS_SELL.description: The total number of sell swap since the start of the current hour.

CURRENT_HOUR_TOTAL_SWAPS_UNKNOWN.description: The total number of unknown swap since the start of the current hour.

CURRENT_HOUR_CHANGE.description: The value change from the CURRENT_HOUR. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_HOUR_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the CURRENT_HOUR. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

CURRENT_DAY_VOLUME.description: The sum of all swap quantities from the start of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) until now. Given in the base asset.

CURRENT_DAY_VOLUME_BUY.description: The sum of all buy swap quantities from the start of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) until now. Given in the base asset.

CURRENT_DAY_VOLUME_SELL.description: The sum of all sell swap quantities from the start of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) until now. Given in the base asset.

CURRENT_DAY_VOLUME_UNKNOWN.description: The sum of all unknown swap quantities from the start of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) until now. Given in the base asset.

CURRENT_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME.description: The sum of all swap quote quantities from the start of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) until now. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_BUY.description: The sum of all buy swap quote quantities from the start of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) until now. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_SELL.description: The sum of all sell swap quote quantities from the start of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) until now. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_UNKNOWN.description: The sum of all unknown swap quote quantities from the start of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) until now. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_DAY_OPEN.description: The open price for the current day, this is based on the closest swap occurring before the start of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC). Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_DAY_HIGH.description: The highest swap price of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC). If there were no updates in the time period, the open price will be given. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_DAY_LOW.description: The lowest swap price of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC). If there were no updates in the time period, the open price will be given. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_DAY_TOTAL_SWAPS.description: The total number of swap that have occurred since the start of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC).

CURRENT_DAY_TOTAL_SWAPS_BUY.description: The total number of buy swap since the start of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC).

CURRENT_DAY_TOTAL_SWAPS_SELL.description: The total number of sell swap since the start of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC).

CURRENT_DAY_TOTAL_SWAPS_UNKNOWN.description: The total number of unknown swap since the start of the current day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC).

CURRENT_DAY_CHANGE.description: The value change from the CURRENT_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the CURRENT_DAY. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

CURRENT_WEEK_VOLUME.description: The sum of all swap quantities from Monday (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) to the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the week. If today is Monday, this value will be 0. Given in the base asset.

CURRENT_WEEK_VOLUME_BUY.description: The sum of all buy swap quantities from Monday (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) to the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the week. If today is Monday, this value will be 0. Given in the base asset.

CURRENT_WEEK_VOLUME_SELL.description: The sum of all sell swap quantities from Monday (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) to the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the week. If today is Monday, this value will be 0. Given in the base asset.

CURRENT_WEEK_VOLUME_UNKNOWN.description: The sum of all unknown swap quantities from Monday (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) to the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the week. If today is Monday, this value will be 0. Given in the base asset.

CURRENT_WEEK_QUOTE_VOLUME.description: The sum of all swap quote quantities from Monday (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) to the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the week. If today is Monday, this value will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_WEEK_QUOTE_VOLUME_BUY.description: The sum of all buy swap quote quantities from Monday (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) to the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the week. If today is Monday, this value will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_WEEK_QUOTE_VOLUME_SELL.description: The sum of all sell swap quote quantities from Monday (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) to the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the week. If today is Monday, this value will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_WEEK_QUOTE_VOLUME_UNKNOWN.description: The sum of all unknown swap quote quantities from Monday (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) to the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the week. If today is Monday, this value will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_WEEK_OPEN.description: The price of the closest swap to Monday (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of this week. In a highly liquid market, this would be the last swap that happened on the previous Sunday at (23:59:59 999 GMT/UTC). This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full weekly value. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_WEEK_HIGH.description: The highest swapped price of the week excluding the current day. The period will run from Monday - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the week. If today is Monday, this value will be the same as CURRENT_WEEK_OPEN. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_WEEK_LOW.description: The lowest swapped price of the week excluding the current day. The period will run from Monday - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the week. If today is Monday, this value will be CURRENT_WEEK_LOW. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_WEEK_TOTAL_SWAPS.description: The total number of swap between Monday (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the week. If today is Monday, this value will be 0.

CURRENT_WEEK_TOTAL_SWAPS_BUY.description: The total number of buy swap between Monday (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the week. If today is Monday, this value will be 0.

CURRENT_WEEK_TOTAL_SWAPS_SELL.description: The total number of sell swap between Monday (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the week. If today is Monday, this value will be 0.

CURRENT_WEEK_TOTAL_SWAPS_UNKNOWN.description: The total number of unknown swap between Monday (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the week. If today is Monday, this value will be 0.

CURRENT_WEEK_CHANGE.description: The value change from the CURRENT_WEEK. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_WEEK_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the CURRENT_WEEK. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

CURRENT_MONTH_VOLUME.description: The sum of all swap quantities from the 1st of the month (xxxx:xx:01 00:00:00 GMT/UTC) to the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the month. If today is the first of the month, this value will be 0. Given in the base asset.

CURRENT_MONTH_VOLUME_BUY.description: The sum of all buy swap quantities from the 1st of the month (xxxx:xx:01 00:00:00 GMT/UTC) to the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the month. If today is the first of the month, this value will be 0. Given in the base asset.

CURRENT_MONTH_VOLUME_SELL.description: The sum of all sell swap quantities from the 1st of the month (xxxx:xx:01 00:00:00 GMT/UTC) to the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the month. If today is the first of the month, this value will be 0. Given in the base asset.

CURRENT_MONTH_VOLUME_UNKNOWN.description: The sum of all unknown swap quantities from the 1st of the month (xxxx:xx:01 00:00:00 GMT/UTC) to the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the month. If today is the first of the month, this value will be 0. Given in the base asset.

CURRENT_MONTH_QUOTE_VOLUME.description: The sum of all swap quote quantities from the 1st of the month (xxxx:xx:01 00:00:00 GMT/UTC) to the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the month. If today is the first of the month, this value will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

If today is the first of the month, this value will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_MONTH_OPEN.description: The price of the closest swap to the 1st day (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of this month. In a highly liquid market, this would be the last swap that happened on the previous month at (23:59:59 999 GMT/UTC). This will always be supplied and there is no need to do any calculation to get the full monthly value. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_MONTH_HIGH.description: The highest swapped price of the month excluding the current day. The period will run from the 1st of the month - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the month. If today is the 1st of the month, this value will be CURRENT_MONTH_OPEN. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_MONTH_LOW.description: The lowest swapped price of the month excluding the current day. The period will run from the 1st of the month - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC to the beginning - 00:00:00 GMT/UTC of the current day of the month. If today is the 1st of the month, this value will be CURRENT_MONTH_OPEN. Given in the quote asset.

CURRENT_MONTH_TOTAL_SWAPS.description: The total number of swap between the 1st of the month (xxxx:xx:01 00:00:00 GMT/UTC) and the beginning (00:00:00 GMT/UTC) of the current day of the month. If today is the 1st of the month, this value will be 0.

LIFETIME_QUOTE_VOLUME.description: The sum of all swap quote quantities of all the swap of this instrument. Given in the quote asset.

LIFETIME_QUOTE_VOLUME_BUY.description: The sum of all buy swap quote quantities of all the swap of this instrument. Given in the quote asset.

LIFETIME_QUOTE_VOLUME_SELL.description: The sum of all sell swap quote quantities of all the swap of this instrument. Given in the quote asset.

LIFETIME_QUOTE_VOLUME_UNKNOWN.description: The sum of all unknown swap quote quantities of all the swap of this instrument. Given in the quote asset.

LIFETIME_OPEN.description: The price of the first swap of the instrument. Given in the quote asset.

LIFETIME_HIGH.description: The price of the highest swap ever executed for this instrument. Given in the quote asset.

LIFETIME_HIGH_TS.description: The the timestamp of the highest swap ever executed for this instrument. Given in the quote asset.

LIFETIME_LOW.description: The price of the lowest swap ever executed for this instrument. Given in the quote asset.

LIFETIME_LOW_TS.description: The timestamp of the lowest swap ever executed for this instrument. Given in the quote asset.

LIFETIME_TOTAL_SWAPS.description: The total number of all swap that have ever been executed for this instrument.

LIFETIME_TOTAL_SWAPS_BUY.description: The total number of all buy swap that have ever been executed for this instrument.

LIFETIME_TOTAL_SWAPS_SELL.description: The total number of all sell swap that have ever been executed for this instrument.

LIFETIME_TOTAL_SWAPS_UNKNOWN.description: The total number of all unknown swap that have ever been executed for this instrument.

LIFETIME_CHANGE.description: The value change from the LIFETIME. If there were no updates in the time period, the value change will be 0. Given in the quote asset.

LIFETIME_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage change from the LIFETIME. If there were no updates in the time period, the percentage change will be 0.

Warn.description: This object is used when multiple parameters are validated and a partial response is returned due to some invalid request parameters. It informs the client of the issues encountered while processing the request and provides details about the specific parameters involved.

type.description: A public facing warning type. If you want to treat a specific warning use the type.

message.example: There are multiple instruments matching your query for WETH-USDT on uniswapv3. We have provided the best match based on our criteria. Other matches include: 0x4e68ccd3e89f51c3074ca5072bbac773960dfa36_2. To select a different match just pass the pool smart contract address and the chain id.

param.description: The parameter that is responsible for the warning

values.description: The values responsible for the warning

Err.description: This object provides detailed information about an error encountered while processing the request. It includes an error code, a message explaining the error, and additional context about the parameters or values that caused the issue. This helps clients identify and resolve issues with their requests.

type.description: A public facing error type. If you want to treat a specific error use the type.

message.example: Not found: market parameter. Value test_market_does_not_exist not integrated yet. We list all markets in lowercase and transform the parameter sent, make sure you check the https://data-api.cryptocompare.com/spot/v1/markets endpoint for a list of all the supported TRADE_SPOT markets

param.description: The parameter that is responsible for the error

values.description: The values responsible for the error

UNIT.description: The unit of the historical period update: MINUTE for minute, HOUR for hour and DAY for day.

TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds of the beginning of the histo period. For minute it would be every minute at the beginning of the minute, for hour it would be the start of the hour and for daily it is 00:00 GMT.

TYPE.description: The internal type of the message.

MARKET.description: The market / exchange under consideration (uniswapv2, uniswapv3 etc.).

INSTRUMENT.description: The unmapped instrument address and the CHAIN_ASSET ID separated by underscore (e.g. 0xe83c76c50033a5396d21ceff9fa192e2550d10ca_2, etc.).

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The instrument id based on asset symbols, as derived from our mapping rules. This is the same as the INSTRUMENT and will not change.

BASE.description: Represents the base asset or coin symbol, commonly known as the ticker (e.g., BTC). This symbol may change in cases of asset rebranding. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

QUOTE.description: Represents the quote asset or counter coin symbol, commonly known as the ticker (e.g., USD). This symbol may change in cases of asset rebranding. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

BASE_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the base asset or coin (e.g., 1 for BTC). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

QUOTE_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the quote asset or counter coin (e.g., 5 for USD). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

TRANSFORM_FUNCTION.description: The transform function (or list of functions concatenated by _AND_). This is the function we apply when we do mapping to change values into easier human readable ones and to make sure the mapped direction BASE - QUOTE is constant accross all chains and instruments.

OPEN.description: The open price for the historical period, this is based on the closest swap before the period start.

HIGH.description: The highest swap price in the time period. If there were no swaps in the time period, the open price will be given.

LOW.description: The lowest swap price in the time period. If there were no swaps in the time period, the open price will be given.

CLOSE.description: The price of the last swap in this time period. If there were no swaps in the time period, the open price will be given.

FIRST_SWAP_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the first swap in this time period. This is only available when there is at least one swap in the time period.

FIRST_SWAP_BLOCK.description: The block of the first swap in the time period. This is only available when there is at least one swap in the time period.

LAST_SWAP_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the last swap in this time period. This is only available when there is at least one swap in the time period.

LAST_SWAP_BLOCK.description: The block of the last swap in the time period. This is only available when there is at least one swap in the time period.

FIRST_SWAP_PRICE.description: The price of the first swap in the time period. This is only available when there is at least one swap in the time period.

HIGH_SWAP_PRICE.description: The highest value of the swaps in the time period. This is only available when there is at least one swap in the time period.

HIGH_SWAP_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the highest swap in the time period. This is only available when there is at least one swap in the time period.

HIGH_SWAP_BLOCK.description: The block of the highest swap in the time period. This is only available when there is at least one swap in the time period.

LOW_SWAP_PRICE.description: The lowest value of the swaps in the time period. This is only available when there is at least one swap in the time period.

LOW_SWAP_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp, in seconds, of the lowest swap in the time period. This is only available when there is at least one swap in the time period.

LOW_SWAP_BLOCK.description: The block of the lowest swap in the time period. This is only available when there is at least one swap in the time period.

LAST_SWAP_PRICE.description: The last swap price in the time period. This is only available when there is at least one swap in the time period.

TOTAL_SWAPS.description: The total number of swaps seen in this time period. If there were no swaps in the time period, 0 will be returned.

TOTAL_SWAPS_BUY.description: The total number of BUY swaps seen in this time period. If there were no swaps in the time period, 0 will be returned.

TOTAL_SWAPS_SELL.description: The total number of SELL swaps seen in this time period. If there were no swaps in the time period, 0 will be returned.

TOTAL_SWAPS_UNKNOWN.description: The total number of UNKNOWN swaps seen in this time period. If there were no swaps in the time period, 0 will be returned.

VOLUME.description: The sum of all the swap volumes in the from asset (base symbol / coin) for the time period. If there were no swaps in the time period, 0 will be returned.

QUOTE_VOLUME.description: The sum of all the swap volumes in the To asset (quote/counter symbol/coin) for the time period. If there were no swaps in the time period, 0 will be returned.

VOLUME_BUY.description: The sum of all the BUY swap volumes in the from asset (base symbol / coin) for the time period.

QUOTE_VOLUME_BUY.description: The sum of all the BUY swap volumes in the to asset (quote/counter symbol/coin) for the time period.

VOLUME_SELL.description: The sum of all the SELL swap volumes in the from asset (base symbol / coin) for the time period.

QUOTE_VOLUME_SELL.description: The sum of all the SELL swap volumes in the To asset (quote/counter symbol/coin) for the time period.

VOLUME_UNKNOWN.description: The sum of all the UNKNOWN swap volumes in the from asset (base symbol / coin) for the time period.

QUOTE_VOLUME_UNKNOWN.description: The sum of all the UNKNOWN swap volumes in the To asset (quote/counter symbol/coin) for the time period.

Warn.description: This object is used when multiple parameters are validated and a partial response is returned due to some invalid request parameters. It informs the client of the issues encountered while processing the request and provides details about the specific parameters involved.

type.description: A public facing warning type. If you want to treat a specific warning use the type.

message.example: There are multiple instruments matching your query for WETH-USDT on uniswapv3. We have provided the best match based on our criteria. Other matches include: 0x4e68ccd3e89f51c3074ca5072bbac773960dfa36_2. To select a different match just pass the pool smart contract address and the chain id.

param.description: The parameter that is responsible for the warning

values.description: The values responsible for the warning

TYPE.description: The internal type of the message.

MARKET.description: The market / exchange under consideration (e.g. uniswapv2, uniswapv3 etc.).

CHAIN_ASSET.description: The asset id for the source chain, eg 2 for ETH.

INSTRUMENT.description: The unmapped instrument address and the CHAIN_ASSET separated by underscore (e.g. 0xe83c76c50033a5396d21ceff9fa192e2550d10ca_2, etc.

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The instrument id based on asset symbols, as derived from our mapping rules. This is the same as the INSTRUMENT and will not change.

BASE.description: Represents the base asset or coin symbol, commonly known as the ticker (e.g. WETH). This symbol may change in cases of asset rebranding. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping

QUOTE.description: Represents the quote asset or counter coin symbol, commonly known as the ticker (e.g. USDT). This symbol may change in cases of asset rebranding. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

BASE_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the base asset or coin (e.g., 1 for BTC). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

QUOTE_ID.description: Represents the internal CCData ID for the quote asset or counter coin (e.g., 5 for USD). This ID is unique and immutable, ensuring consistent identification. Applicable only to instruments with a mapping.

TRANSFORM_FUNCTION.description: The transform function (or list of functions concatenated by _AND_). This is the function we apply when we do mapping to change values into easier human readable ones and to make sure the mapped direction BASE - QUOTE is constant accross all chains and instruments.

SIDE.description: The side of the trade: SELL, BUY or UNKNOWN. If the exchange / api does not provide a side, "UNKNOWN" will be returned.

ID.description: The unique ID of the swap - constructed by appending the transaction hash and the transaction log index where the swap was discovered.

TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds derived from the block time in which the transaction was found.

TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the reported TIMESTAMP field.

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds that the transaction was processed by the integration internally.

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP field.

QUANTITY.description: The volume of the trade, given in the base instrument. E.g. for a dex WETH-USDT swap, this is how much WETH was swapped at the trade price.

PRICE.description: The price in terms of the quote instrument of the swap. For a WETH-USDT swap, this is how much was swapped for one WETH in USDT.

QUOTE_QUANTITY.description: The volume of the trade, given in the quote instrument. This is equivalent to QUANTITY * PRICE. (E.g. for a WETH-USDT trade, this is how much USDT was traded in total for the volume of WETH swapped.).

SOURCE.description: The source of the trade update: POLLING, STREAMING, GO, BLOB etc. Used internally

CCSEQ.description: Our internal sequence number for this trade, this is unique per market / exchange and trading pair. Should always be increasing by 1 for each new trade we discover, not in chronological order.

TRANSACTION_HASH.description: This is a unique cryptographic identifier that represents the specific transaction on the blockchain where the swap was discovered

BLOCK_NUMBER.description: This represents the specific block on the blockchain where the swap was discovered.

FROM.description: The address of the wallet who initiated the swap.

MARKET_FEE_PERCENTAGE.description: The trading fee (in percentage) charged for each transaction that occurs for this instrument on the exchange

MARKET_FEE_VALUE.description: The trading fee charged for this transaction, calculated using the market fee percentage and quantity/quote_quantity based on whether it is a buy or a sell. In uniswapv2/v3 the fee is calculated from the input instrument wrt the pool. (E.g. if it is a BUY, the input instrument is the QUOTE, if it is a sell - the input instrument is the BASE.)

PROVIDER_KEY.description: The data source for the onchain data: internal_geth, quicknode, infura, etc.

STATUS.description: The status of the update.

Data.description: An array containing valid amm swaps for the requested time period. Amm swaps are ordered by CCSEQ, which generally reflects the order of their calculation timestamps. Any backfilled amm swaps that are added later will appear at the end of the array. This ensures a reliable and sequential view of amm swap data, including historical corrections. If an amm swap was initially deemed valid but later determined to have been sent in error or processed incorrectly, it is removed from this array and added to the "Invalid" array. We retain invalid amm swaps in a separate array to maintain the continuity of CCSEQ and ensure there are no gaps in the sequence.

Data.description: An array containing valid and invalid amm swaps for the requested time period. Amm swaps are ordered by CCSEQ, which generally reflects the order of their calculation. Any backfilled amm swaps that are added later will appear at the end of the array. This ensures a reliable and sequential view of amm swaps data, including historical corrections. We retain invalid amm swaps to maintain the continuity of CCSEQ and ensure there are no gaps in the sequence. You can elimiate invalid amm swaps from the response by setting the skip_invalid_messages paramater to true, keep in mind that by doing this you will have gaps in the CCSEQ of each amm swap and you can no longer easily guarantee you have received all the amm swaps.

TYPE.description: The internal type of the message.

MARKET.description: The market / exchange under consideration (e.g. uniswapv2, uniswapv3 etc.).

MAPPED_INSTRUMENT.description: The mapped instrument ID after applying our mapping rules. This takes the form: "BASE-QUOTE"s and is available only for instruments that have been mapped (e.g. WETH-USDT).

ID.description: The unique ID - constructed by appending the transaction hash and the transaction log index where the liquidity update event was discovered.

TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds derived from the block time in which the transaction was found.

TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the reported TIMESTAMP field.

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP.description: The timestamp in seconds that the transaction was processed by the integration internally.

RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP_NS.description: The nanosecond part of the RECEIVED_TIMESTAMP field.

SOURCE.description: The source of the trade update: POLLING, STREAMING, GO, BLOB etc. Used Internally

CCSEQ.description: Our internal sequence number for this trade, this is unique per market / exchange and trading pair. Should always be increasing by 1 for each new trade we discover, not in chronological order.

TRANSACTION_HASH.description: This is a unique cryptographic identifier that represents the specific transaction on the blockchain where the liquidity update event was discovered

BLOCK_NUMBER.description: This represents the specific block on the blockchain where the liquidity update event was discovered.

FROM.description: The address of the wallet who initiated the change.

CHANGE_IN_BASE.description: The change in the quantity of the base instrument within the liquidity pool.

CHANGE_IN_QUOTE.description: The change in the quantity of the quote instrument within the liquidity pool

CHANGE_IN_INVARIANT.description: This change in the invariant due to the liquidity update that has occurred. Note that for uniswapv2 based DEX, the fee from a swap is added to the invariant automatically which results in a slight positive CHANGE_IN_INVARIANT when a swap occurs. For uniswapv3 based DEX, the fee from swaps is kept separate and not contributing to the invariant and CHANGE_IN_INVARIANT should be 0

PROVIDER_KEY.description: The data source for the onchain data: internal_geth, quicknode, infura, etc.

TICK.description: This is the tick value from which the price can be derived. This field is only available on trades from uniswapv3 or uniswapv3 forks where the EVENT field is a SWAP.

LOWER_BOUND_TICK.description: This is the lower tick limit of the range where the liquidity provider wants to allocate their capital. This field is only available on trades from uniswapv3 or uniswapv3 forks only. For trades where EVENT field is SWAP, this field value defaults to 0.

UPPER_BOUND_TICK.description: This is the upper tick limit of the range where the liquidity provider wants to allocate their capital. This field is only available on trades from uniswapv3 or uniswapv3 forks only. For trades where EVENT field is SWAP, this field value defaults to 0.

STATUS.description: The status of the update.

Data.description: An array containing valid and invalid amm liquidity updates for the requested time period. Amm liquidity updates are ordered by CCSEQ, which generally reflects the order of their calculation. Any backfilled amm liquidity updates that are added later will appear at the end of the array. This ensures a reliable and sequential view of amm liquidity updates data, including historical corrections. If an amm liquidity update was initially deemed valid but later determined to have been sent in error or processed incorrectly the STATUS field will be changed to reflect this. We retain invalid amm liquidity updates to maintain the continuity of CCSEQ and ensure there are no gaps in the sequence. You can elimiate invalid amm liquidity updates from the response by setting the skip_invalid_messages paramater to true, keep in mind that by doing this you will have gaps in the CCSEQ of each amm liquidity update and you can no longer easily guarantee you have received all the amm liquidity updates.

TICK.description: This is the tick value from which the price can be derived. This field is only available on trades from uniswapv3 or uniswapv3 forks where the EVENT field is a SWAP.

LOWER_BOUND_TICK.description: This is the lower tick limit of the range where the liquidity provider wants to allocate their capital. This field is only available on trades from uniswapv3 or uniswapv3 forks only. For trades where EVENT field is SWAP, this field value defaults to 0.

UPPER_BOUND_TICK.description: This is the upper tick limit of the range where the liquidity provider wants to allocate their capital. This field is only available on trades from uniswapv3 or uniswapv3 forks only. For trades where EVENT field is SWAP, this field value defaults to 0.

STATUS.description: The status of the update.

Data.description: An array containing valid amm liquidity updates for the requested time period. Amm liquidity updates are ordered by CCSEQ, which generally reflects the order of their calculation timestamps. Any backfilled amm liquidity updates that are added later will appear at the end of the array. This ensures a reliable and sequential view of amm liquidity update data, including historical corrections. If an amm liquidity update was initially deemed valid but later determined to have been sent in error or processed incorrectly, it is removed from this array and added to the "Invalid" array. We retain invalid amm liquidity updates in a separate array to maintain the continuity of CCSEQ and ensure there are no gaps in the sequence.

Warn.description: This object is used when multiple parameters are validated and a partial response is returned due to some invalid request parameters. It informs the client of the issues encountered while processing the request and provides details about the specific parameters involved.

type.description: A public facing warning type. If you want to treat a specific warning use the type.

message.example: There are multiple instruments matching your query for WETH-USDT on uniswapv3. We have provided the best match based on our criteria. Other matches include: 0x4e68ccd3e89f51c3074ca5072bbac773960dfa36_2. To select a different match just pass the pool smart contract address and the chain id.

param.description: The parameter that is responsible for the warning

values.description: The values responsible for the warning

METADATA_VERSION.description: The version of metadata, used for version conversions/migrates.

INSTRUMENT_STATUS.description: The status of the instrument, we only poll / stream / connect to the ACTIVE ones, for the RETIRED / IGNORED / EXPIRED / READY_FOR_DECOMMISSIONING means we no longer query/stream data.

INSTRUMENT.description: The instrument ID as it is on the exchange with small modifications - we do not allow the following characters inside isntrument ids: ,/&?

INSTRUMENT_MAPPING.description: The current mapping information for this instrument

INSTRUMENT_EXTERNAL_DATA.description: The full data we get from the polling endpoint for this specific instrument. This is a JSON stringified object with different properties per exchange.

CHAIN_ASSET.description: The asset id for the source chain, eg 2 for ETH.

INSTRUMENT_BASE_TOKEN_ADDRESS.description: The instrument base token address, retrieved from the zeroth index in the transaction log args property

INSTRUMENT_QUOTE_TOKEN_ADDRESS.description: The instrument quote token address, retrieved from the first index in the transaction log args property

INSTRUMENT_CREATION_BLOCK_TS.description: The timestamp at which the instrument block was created.

INSTRUMENT_CREATION_BLOCK_NUMBER.description: The block number where the instrument was created.

INSTRUMENT_CREATION_TRANSACTION_HASH.description: The hash of the transaction that created the instrument.

INSTRUMENT_DATA_AVAILABLE_OUTSIDE_VM.description: Specifies whether the instrument's metadata should be synced to Global Redis

INSTRUMENT_MARKET_FEE_PERCENTAGE.description: The trading fee (in percentage) charged for each transaction that occurs for this instrument on the exchange

INSTRUMENT_TICK_SPACING.description: The distance between each tick as determined by the pool's fee tier

ARCHIVE_STATUS.description: The archive status of the instrument

HOST_MIGRATION_STATUS.description: The migration status of the symbol, we only poll / stream / connect empty or SETTLED

INSTRUMENT_AMM_SWAP_ONCHAIN_REST_URL.description: The URL we send to the proxy swarm to get AMM_SWAP_ONCHAIN for the instrument.

INSTRUMENT_AMM_SWAP_ONCHAIN_IS_READY_FOR.description: This flags the exchange instrument as in ready to consume AMM_SWAP_ONCHAIN via a streaming integration.

TOTAL_AMM_SWAPS_ONCHAIN.description: This is both the CCSEQ and the total AMM_SWAPS_ONCHAIN we have processed on this instrument

LAST_CONCURRENT_BATCH_OF_AMM_SWAPS_ONCHA.description: The timestamp last encountered where the batch of trades from AMM_SWAPS_ONCHAIN all occured at the same time. This is an issue when making the next request that requires polling by timestamp as a start/from parameter

Other matches include: 0x4e68ccd3e89f51c3074ca5072bbac773960dfa36_2. To select a different match just pass the pool smart contract address and the chain id.

param.description: The parameter that is responsible for the warning

values.description: The values responsible for the warning

Err.description: This object provides detailed information about an error encountered while processing the request. It includes an error code, a message explaining the error, and additional context about the parameters or values that caused the issue. This helps clients identify and resolve issues with their requests.

type.description: A public facing error type. If you want to treat a specific error use the type.

message.example: Not found: market parameter. Value test_market_does_not_exist not integrated yet. We list all markets in lowercase and transform the parameter sent, make sure you check the https://data-api.cryptocompare.com/spot/v1/markets endpoint for a list of all the supported TRADE_SPOT markets

param.description: The parameter that is responsible for the error

values.description: The values responsible for the error

EXCHANGE_STATUS.description: The status of the exchange. We only poll / stream / connect to the ACTIVE ones, for the RETIRED ones we no longer query for data

MAPPED_INSTRUMENTS_TOTAL.description: The total number of instruments that have been verified by our mapping team and have been properly assigned with a base, quote, mapping function, and other necessary fields. This is done to ensure that pairs like XXBTZUSD are accurately mapped to BTC-USD and that the pair refers to the correct assets rather than using the same asset id to represent different assets.

UNMAPPED_INSTRUMENTS_TOTAL.description: The number of instruments that have not yet been verified by our mapping team.

INSTRUMENT_STATUS.description: An object with the total number of instrument for each of the available instrument statuses.

ACTIVE.description: The total number of instruments currently available on the market, which are considered active. An active instrument is defined as an instrument from which we retrieve data and have either already mapped or are planning to map.

IGNORED.description: The total number of instruments available on the market that are classified as ignored, meaning that we do not plan to map them. Ignored instruments are those from which we do retrieve data but do not have any intention to map.

RETIRED.description: The total number of instruments that are classified as retired, meaning that they are no longer actively traded on the market. These instruments have ceased trading, and as such, we do not retrieve data from them but we have mapped them already.

EXPIRED.description: The total number of instruments that are classified as expired, meaning that they are mapped instruments that are no longer actively traded on the market. These expired instruments are typically futures or options instruments that have reached their expiration date and are no longer available for trading. While we have previously mapped these instruments, we do not retrieve any data from them since they are no longer actively traded.

TOTAL_AMM_SWAPS_ONCHAIN.description: The total number of defi swap trades this exchange has processed.

TOTAL_AMM_LIQUIDITY_UPDATES_ONCHAIN.description: The total number of defi liquidity updates this exchange has processed.

ID.description: The unique identifier for the exchange entry

EXCHANGE_INTERNAL_NAME.description: Internal mapped name for a specific exchange

URI.description: The uri path that this exchange will be found on / url-slug

COMMENT.description: Any internal comments you might have for this exchange

IS_PUBLIC.description: This is flagged to false when exchanges are deleted/hidden

ASSIGNED_TO.description: Internal user id of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the exchange

ASSIGNED_TO_USERNAME.description: Internal username of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the exchange at the time of the exchange assignment (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

CREATED_BY.description: Internal user id of the user who created the exchange

CREATED_BY_USERNAME.description: Internal username of the user who created the exchange at the time of the exchange creation (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

UPDATED_ON.description: Exchange internal last updated unix ts in our system

UPDATED_BY.description: Internal user id of the user who last updated the exchange

UPDATED_BY_USERNAME.description: Internal username of the user who last updated the internal information of the exchange at the time of the exchange update (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

ASSIGNED_TO_INTEGRATION_MAIN.description: Internal user id of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the exchange integration

ASSIGNED_TO_USERNAME_INTEGRATION_MAIN.description: Internal username of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the exchange integration at the time of the exchange assignment (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

ASSIGNED_TO_INTEGRATION_BACKUP.description: Internal user id of the user who is the backup for updating and maintaining the exchange integration

ASSIGNED_TO_USERNAME_INTEGRATION_BACKUP.description: Internal username of the user who is the backup for maintaining the exchange integration at the time of the exchange assignment (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

ASSIGNED_TO_BUSINESS_OR_CONTRACT.description: Internal user id of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the exchange contract data

ASSIGNED_TO_USERNAME_BUSINESS_OR_CONTRAC.description: Internal username of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the exchange contract data at the time of the exchange assignment (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

PUBLIC_NOTICE.description: A public notice for this exchange.

EXCHANGE_SUSPENSION_REASON.description: This specifies the underlying cause leading to the suspension of trading activities on the exchange. This information is critical for transparency and assists in the decision-making process for users and stakeholders. Selecting an option from this dropdown provides clarity on the nature of the suspension, whether it's temporary or permanent.

TRADING_PERMANENTLY_SUSPENDED_DATE.description: The retire date of the exchange is indicated as (yyyy-mm-dd).

NAME.description: The full name of the exchange, e.g. Coinbase.

LAUNCH_DATE.description: The launch date of the exchange is indicated as (yyyy-mm-dd).

IS_EXCLUDED_FROM_METRICS_AND_TOPLISTS.description: Indicates whether the exchange instruments should be excluded from the overall volumes and asset markets toplist. Basically exclude it from all aggregations.

HAS_SPOT_TRADING.description: This is set to true if is a centralized exchange and it offers spot trading.

HAS_FUTURES_TRADING.description: This is set to true if is a centralized exchange and it offers futures trading.

HAS_INDEX_PUBLISHING.description: This is set to true if is a centralized exchange and it offers index publishing.

HAS_OPTIONS_TRADING.description: This is set to true if is a centralized exchange and it offers options trading.

HAS_DEX_TRADING.description: This is set to true if is a decentralized exchange and it offers spot trading that is based on automated market making smart contract.

DEX_TRADING_MECHANISMS.description: Defines the operational mechanisms used for trading on a decentralized exchange.

NAME.description: The name of the trading mechanism

DEX_TRADING_SUPPORTED_PLATFORMS.description: When an exchange can be used on multiple blockchains, we refer to those blockchains as supported platforms.

BLOCKCHAIN.description: This is linked to the asset representing a specific chain.

FACTORY_ADDRESS.description: Contract/smart contract/address for the factory contract on the specific blockchain platform.

LAUNCH_DATE.description: The data the dex exchange was deployed on this chain.

LAUNCH_BLOCK_NUMBER.description: The deploy block number of the dex

INTEGRATION_STAGE.description: The current stage of the exchange integration process

INTEGRATION_DATE.description: The data the dex exchange was integrated.

NAME.description: The name of the event

SMART_CONTRACTS_INVOLVED.description: Special addresses of smart contracts that are involved in the L2 scaling solution.

NAME.description: The name of the smart contract

ADDRESS.description: The address of the smart contract

IS_UPGRADABLE.description: Tick this box if the smart contract is upgradable

DESCRIPTION.description: A description for the dex exchange.

DEX_API_ACCESS_PERMITTED_ROLES.description: Defines role-based access control for the DEX API. This configuration allows Data API access to be restricted to users assigned specific roles, as specified in a JSON array. Each role entry is validated to ensure compliance with defined role names and permissions, allowing for controlled API access and streamlined role management.

WEBSITE_URL.description: The link for the official exchange website.

BLOG_URL.description: The link for the official blog.

INCORPORATION_DOCUMENT_URL.description: The URL providing access to the projectâ€™s incorporation documents. These documents offer legal information about the companyâ€™s establishment and its legal standing.

WHITE_PAPER_URL.description: The URL providing access to the projectâ€™s white paper. A white paper gives investors and stakeholders technical and conceptual information about the projectâ€™s purpose, mechanics, and vision.

OTHER_DOCUMENT_URLS.description: Other documents that might be relevant to the exchange, they should all be PDFs.

TYPE.description: The category of document being uploaded.

VERSION.description: The version number of the document if applicable.

URL.description: Upload the PDF document containing point-in-time information captured from the exchange.

ORIGINAL_SOURCE_URL.description: The original URL on the exchange website where this document was found or downloaded from.

COMMENT.description: Additional notes or context about the document.

EXCHANGE_CERTIFICATIONS.description: Defines the specific certifications or accreditations that an exchange has obtained.

NAME.description: The name of the certification or accreditation

ID.description: The certification id.

URL.description: The URL of cerification document if there is one.

SUPPORT_CONTACT_INFORMATION.description: Various channels through which customers can reach out to the exchange for support.

DETAILS.description: Specific details like email address, phone number, URL, etc., for the selected contact medium.

COMMENTS.description: Any additional comments or notes regarding the support contact.

CONTROLLED_ADDRESSES.description: The list of designated addresses used to manage and store assets within an investment portfolio or on behalf of clients. This includes addresses where cryptocurrencies, securities, or other assets are held, reflecting the diverse nature of modern investment strategies. It encompasses addresses used by exchanges, ETFs, and companies to maintain their investment reserves or operational funds.

BLOCKCHAIN.description: The is linked to the asset representing a specific chain.

ADDRESS.description: The address of the smart contracts, external user accounts or other account

ADDRESS_PURPOSE.description: The role of the address within the company's operations, aiding in precise asset management and regulatory compliance. This categorization distinguishes between addresses for investments, client custody, and operational expenses, streamlining asset control and reporting.

CONTROL_TYPE.description: Classifies the level and nature of control the company exercises over various cryptocurrency addresses. This categorization helps delineate the operational and security protocols associated with each address, ranging from single-key direct control to multi-signatory arrangements and even non-control strategies.

NAME.description: The name of the address. Contract name or just the common name for this address.

DESCRIPTION.description: A description for the address.

IS_INCLUDED_IN_CADLI.description: Indicates whether the asset is part of the CADLI index, which calculates the price of an asset in USD. This field is crucial for tracking asset inclusion in CADLI, aiding in data analysis and decision-making processes related to asset pricing.

EXCHANGE_ALTERNATIVE_IDS.description: A collection of alternative identification data for exchanges as recognized by various data platforms.

NAME.description: The name of the alternative data platform or identifier.

ID.description: The unique identifier associated with the exchange on the alternative platform.

CURRENTLY_IN_USE.description: Indicates whether this alternative ID is currently in use.

EXCHANGE_DESCRIPTION.description: The long form description in markdown for this exchange.

EXCHANGE_DESCRIPTION_SUMMARY.description: The short form description text only for this exchange.

EXCHANGE_DESCRIPTION_SNIPPET.description: The shortest form description text only for this exchange. This is a lot more limited than the summary. Generally this is a one or maximum two sentences.

IS_HIDDEN.description: Indicates whether the exchange is hidden.

DEX_INTEGRATION_COMMENTS.description: Any internal comments for the DEX integration.

DEX_TRADING_LAUNCH_DATE.description: The launch date of the exchange is indicated as (yyyy-mm-dd).

CCDATA_LATEST_DEX_BENCHMARK_SCORE.description: This is a measure of the total number of benchmark score out of 100. It is the sum of all the individual section score in the latest benchmark report.

CCDATA_LATEST_DEX_BENCHMARK_GRADE.description: This is a measure of the grade the exchange has based on the benchmark score. We classify anything over B to be a top tier exchange.

CCDATA_HISTORICAL_DEX_BENCHMARK_REPORTS.description: An array holding the series of benchmark reports data for the exchange. Each element in the array corresponds to a set of data from a specific report, collectively providing a comprehensive historical record of the exchange's performance metrics over time.

PUBLICATION_DATE.description: Indicates the date each report was published, serving as a historical marker for the data and allowing for chronological analysis of the exchange's performance.

OVERALL_SCORE.description: Represents the overall score assigned in each benchmark report, encapsulating various performance metrics to reflect the exchange's effectiveness and reliability at each historical point.

OVERALL_GRADE.description: Denotes the grade given in each report, categorizing the exchange's performance into a specific tier, enabling a comparative assessment over time
