ROOT_ASSET_ID.description: Identifies the root asset in a chain of derived or related assets, essential for tracing asset lineage. Null if the asset does not have a parent. For example, the fiat USD (id: 5) would be the root asset for the tokens CUSDC (id: 1623) or USDCE (id: 1728).

ROOT_ASSET_SYMBOL.description: The symbol of the root asset, facilitating recognition and correlation within asset hierarchies. Null if the asset does not have a parent. For example, the fiat USD (id: 5) would be the root asset for the tokens CUSDC (id: 1623) or USDCE (id: 1728).

ROOT_ASSET_TYPE.description: Specifies the fundamental category of the root asset, crucial for understanding the base or origin of an asset's classification. Null if the asset does not have a parent. For example, the fiat USD would be the root asset for tokens CUSDC or USDCE, and in this case, the ROOT_ASSET_TYPE would be fiat.

PRICE_USD.description: Denotes the current value / price of the asset in USD. This value is used to populate toplists and is calculated based on real-time market data.

PRICE_USD_SOURCE.description: Denotes the source we used for the USD value / price.

PRICE_USD_LAST_UPDATE_TS.description: The Unix timestamp of the last update to the USD value / price of the asset.

PRICE_CONVERSION_ASSET.description: Denotes the convesion asset ID, SYMBOL and ASSET_TYPE.

ID.description: The unique identifier for the asset entry

SYMBOL.description: Internal mapped symbol for a specific asset

ASSET_TYPE.description: The type of the asset (FIAT, BLOCKCHAIN, TOKEN, etc.)

PRICE_CONVERSION_RATE.description: Denotes the current value / price of USD in the requested quote asset.

PRICE_CONVERSION_VALUE.description: Denotes the current value / price of the asset in the requested quote currency.

PRICE_CONVERSION_SOURCE.description: Denotes the source we used for the conversion asset value / price.

PRICE_CONVERSION_LAST_UPDATE_TS.description: The Unix timestamp of the last update to the conversion asset value / price.

CIRCULATING_MKT_CAP_USD.description: Calculated as the product of the asset's circulating supply and its current price quoted in USD (we sometimes apply a MKT_CAP_PENALTY depending on liquidity conditions). This is used to rank assets in toplists based on their circulating market capitalization.

TOTAL_MKT_CAP_USD.description: Calculated as the product of the asset's total supply and its current price quoted in USD (we sometimes apply a MKT_CAP_PENALTY depending on liquidity conditions). This figure gives an overview of the total value of all issued tokens for a given asset.

CIRCULATING_MKT_CAP_CONVERSION.description: Calculated as the product of the asset's circulating supply and its current price quoted in conversion asset (we sometimes apply a MKT_CAP_PENALTY depending on liquidity conditions). We calculate this field by multiplying the CIRCULATING_MKT_CAP_USD and the PRICE_CONVERSION_VALUE.

TOTAL_MKT_CAP_CONVERSION.description: Calculated as the product of the asset's total supply and its current price quoted in conversion asset (we sometimes apply a MKT_CAP_PENALTY depending on liquidity conditions). We calculate this field by multiplying the TOTAL_MKT_CAP_USD and the PRICE_CONVERSION_VALUE.

SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIE.description: Aggregated 24 hours volume of the asset traded accross instruments that are quoted in USD on spot markets that we consider top tier, quoted in USD. Provides insights into the USD liquidity and trading activity of the asset on top tier spot markets.

SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_DIRECT_.description: Aggregated 24 hours volume of the asset traded accross instruments that are quoted in USD on all the intergarted spot markets, quoted in USD. Provides insights into the USD liquidity and trading activity of the asset.

SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIE.description: Aggregated 24 hours volume of the asset traded accross all instruments on spot markets that we consider top tier, quoted in USD. This is the sum of all the trade volumes on all the spot top tier markets, every trade volume is converted to USD using the most accurate conversion price at the time of the trade. These markets meet specific quality criteria, offering a more curated view of trading activity.

SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_USD.description: Aggregated 24 hours volume of the asset traded accross all instruments on all the integrated spot markets, quoted in USD. This is the sum of all the trade volumes on all the spot markets, every trade volume is converted to USD using the most accurate conversion price at the time of the trade. Useful for understanding demand and trading interest.

SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIE.description: Aggregated 24 hours volume of the asset traded accross all instruments on spot markets that we consider top tier, quoted in conversion asset. We calculate this field by multiplying the SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER_USD and the PRICE_CONVERSION_VALUE.

SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_CONVERS.description: Aggregated 24 hours volume of the asset traded accross all instruments on all the integrated spot markets. We calculate this field by multiplying the SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_USD and the PRICE_CONVERSION_VALUE.

SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_CHANGE_USD.description: The difference between the value of the asset quoted in USD 24 hours ago and the latest USD price.

SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_US.description: The percentage difference between the value of the asset quoted in USD 24 hours ago and the latest USD price.

SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_CHANGE_CONVERSION.description: The approximate difference between the value of the asset quoted conversion currency 23 hours ago and now. We calculate this field by multiplying the SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_CHANGE_USD and the PRICE_CONVERSION_VALUE. This figure does not take into account the volatility of the conversion asset quoted in USD.

SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_CO.description: The percentage difference between the value of the asset quoted in USD 24 hours ago and the latest USD price. This is the same as the SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_USD just adding it here for easier access.

SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER_.description: Aggregated 7 days volume of the asset traded accross instruments that are quoted in USD on spot markets that we consider top tier, quoted in USD. Provides insights into the USD liquidity and trading activity of the asset on top tier spot markets.

SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_DIRECT_US.description: Aggregated 7 days volume of the asset traded accross instruments that are quoted in USD on all the intergarted spot markets, quoted in USD. Provides insights into the USD liquidity and trading activity of the asset.

SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER_.description: Aggregated 7 days volume of the asset traded accross all instruments on spot markets that we consider top tier, quoted in USD. This is the sum of all the trade volumes on all the spot top tier markets, every trade volume is converted to USD using the most accurate conversion price at the time of the trade. These markets meet specific quality criteria, offering a more curated view of trading activity.

SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_USD.description: Aggregated 7 days volume of the asset traded accross all instruments on all the integrated spot markets, quoted in USD. This is the sum of all the trade volumes on all the spot markets, every trade volume is converted to USD using the most accurate conversion price at the time of the trade. Useful for understanding demand and trading interest.

SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER_.description: Aggregated 7 days volume of the asset traded accross all instruments on spot markets that we consider top tier, quoted in conversion asset. We calculate this field by multiplying the SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER_USD and the PRICE_CONVERSION_VALUE.

SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_CONVERSIO.description: Aggregated 7 days volume of the asset traded accross all instruments on all the integrated spot markets. We calculate this field by multiplying the SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_USD and the PRICE_CONVERSION_VALUE.

SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_CHANGE_USD.description: The difference between the value of the asset quoted in USD 7 days ago and the latest USD price.

SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_USD.description: The percentage difference between the value of the asset quoted in USD 7 days ago and the latest USD price.

SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_CHANGE_CONVERSION.description: The approximate difference between the value of the asset quoted conversion currency 6 days ago and current day. We calculate this field by multiplying the SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_CHANGE_USD and the PRICE_CONVERSION_VALUE. This figure does not take into account the volatility of the conversion asset quoted in USD.

SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_CONV.description: The percentage difference between the value of the asset quoted in USD 7 days ago and the latest USD price. This is the same as the SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_USD just adding it here for easier access.

SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER.description: Aggregated 30 days volume of the asset traded accross instruments that are quoted in USD on spot markets that we consider top tier, quoted in USD. Provides insights into the USD liquidity and trading activity of the asset on top tier spot markets.

SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_DIRECT_U.description: Aggregated 30 days volume of the asset traded accross instruments that are quoted in USD on all the intergarted spot markets, quoted in USD. Provides insights into the USD liquidity and trading activity of the asset.

SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER.description: Aggregated 30 days volume of the asset traded accross all instruments on spot markets that we consider top tier, quoted in USD. This is the sum of all the trade volumes on all the spot top tier markets, every trade volume is converted to USD using the most accurate conversion price at the time of the trade. These markets meet specific quality criteria, offering a more curated view of trading activity.

SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_USD.description: Aggregated 30 days volume of the asset traded accross all instruments on all the integrated spot markets, quoted in USD. This is the sum of all the trade volumes on all the spot markets, every trade volume is converted to USD using the most accurate conversion price at the time of the trade. Useful for understanding demand and trading interest.

SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER.description: Aggregated 30 days volume of the asset traded accross all instruments on spot markets that we consider top tier, quoted in conversion asset. We calculate this field by multiplying the SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER_USD and the PRICE_CONVERSION_VALUE.

SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_CONVERSI.description: Aggregated 30 days volume of the asset traded accross all instruments on all the integrated spot markets. We calculate this field by multiplying the SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_USD and the PRICE_CONVERSION_VALUE.

SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_CHANGE_USD.description: The difference between the value of the asset quoted in USD 30 days ago and the latest USD price.

SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_USD.description: The percentage difference between the value of the asset quoted in USD 30 days ago and the latest USD price.

SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_CHANGE_CONVERSION.description: The approximate difference between the value of the asset quoted conversion currency 29 days ago and current day. We calculate this field by multiplying the SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_CHANGE_USD and the PRICE_CONVERSION_VALUE. This figure does not take into account the volatility of the conversion asset quoted in USD.

SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_CON.description: The percentage difference between the value of the asset quoted in USD 30 days ago and the latest USD price. This is the same as the SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_USD just adding it here for easier access.

TOPLIST_BASE_RANK.description: Indicates the assetâ€™s position in our global asset ranking. There are multiple ranks, each is determined by at least one factor, such as asset launch date, market cap, trading volume, etc..

CREATED_ON.description: Rank based on CREATED_ON sorted ASC from earliest created to most recent one.

LAUNCH_DATE.description: Rank based on LAUNCH_DATE sorted ASC from earliest launched to most recently launched one.

PRICE_USD.description: Rank based on PRICE_USD sorted DESC from most expensive asset to cheapest one.

CIRCULATING_MKT_CAP_USD.description: Rank based on CIRCULATING_MKT_CAP_USD sorted DESC from highest circulating market cap to lowest.

TOTAL_MKT_CAP_USD.description: Rank based on TOTAL_MKT_CAP_USD sorted DESC from highest total market cap to lowest.

SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIE.description: Rank based on SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER_DIRECT_USD sorted DESC from highest quote volume accross top tier markets that trade directly to USD to lowest.

SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_DIRECT_.description: Rank based on SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_DIRECT_USD sorted DESC from highest volume accross all markets that trade directly to USD to lowest.

SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIE.description: Rank based on SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER_USD sorted DESC from highest quote volume accross top tier markets to lowest.

SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_USD.description: Rank based on SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_QUOTE_VOLUME_USD sorted DESC from highest quote volume accross all markets to lowest.

SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_CHANGE_USD.description: Rank based on SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_CHANGE_USD sorted DESC from highest change accross all markets to lowest.

SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_US.description: Rank based on SPOT_MOVING_24_HOUR_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_USD sorted DESC from highest percentage change accross all markets to lowest.

SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER_.description: Rank based on SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER_DIRECT_USD sorted DESC from highest quote volume accross top tier markets that trade directly to USD to lowest.

SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_DIRECT_US.description: Rank based on SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_DIRECT_USD sorted DESC from highest volume accross all markets that trade directly to USD to lowest.

SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER_.description: Rank based on SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER_USD sorted DESC from highest quote volume accross top tier markets to lowest.

SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_USD.description: Rank based on SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_USD sorted DESC from highest quote volume accross all markets to lowest.

SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_CHANGE_USD.description: Rank based on SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_CHANGE_USD sorted DESC from highest change accross all markets to lowest.

SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_USD.description: Rank based on SPOT_MOVING_7_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_USD sorted DESC from highest percentage change accross all markets to lowest.

SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER.description: Rank based on SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER_DIRECT_USD sorted DESC from highest quote volume accross top tier markets that trade directly to USD to lowest.

SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_DIRECT_U.description: Rank based on SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_DIRECT_USD sorted DESC from highest volume accross all markets that trade directly to USD to lowest.

SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER.description: Rank based on SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_TOP_TIER_USD sorted DESC from highest quote volume accross top tier markets to lowest.

SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_USD.description: Rank based on SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_QUOTE_VOLUME_USD sorted DESC from highest quote volume accross all markets to lowest.

SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_CHANGE_USD.description: Rank based on SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_CHANGE_USD sorted DESC from highest change accross all markets to lowest.

SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_USD.description: Rank based on SPOT_MOVING_30_DAY_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_USD sorted DESC from highest percentage change accross all markets to lowest.

TOTAL_ENDPOINTS_OK.description: Total endpoints we have successfully called in the last 24 hours.

TOTAL_ENDPOINTS_WITH_ISSUES.description: Total endpoints that have not had a successfull call in the last 24 hours.

Warn.description: This object is used when multiple parameters are validated and a partial response is returned due to some invalid request parameters. It informs the client of the issues encountered while processing the request and provides details about the specific parameters involved.

type.description: A public facing warning type. If you want to treat a specific warning use the type.

message.example: There are multiple instruments matching your query for WETH-USDT on uniswapv3. We have provided the best match based on our criteria. Other matches include: 0x4e68ccd3e89f51c3074ca5072bbac773960dfa36_2. To select a different match just pass the pool smart contract address and the chain id.

param.description: The parameter that is responsible for the warning

values.description: The values responsible for the warning

Err.description: This object provides detailed information about an error encountered while processing the request. It includes an error code, a message explaining the error, and additional context about the parameters or values that caused the issue. This helps clients identify and resolve issues with their requests.

type.description: A public facing error type. If you want to treat a specific error use the type.

message.example: Not found: market parameter. Value test_market_does_not_exist not integrated yet. We list all markets in lowercase and transform the parameter sent, make sure you check the https://data-api.cryptocompare.com/spot/v1/markets endpoint for a list of all the supported TRADE_SPOT markets

param.description: The parameter that is responsible for the error

values.description: The values responsible for the error

STATS.description: Provides detailed information about the pagination of the toplist, including current page, page size, and total assets available. This metadata enables users to navigate and manage the displayed toplist data efficiently.

PAGE.description: Indicates the current page number in the toplist, helping users track their position within paginated data.

PAGE_SIZE.description: Specifies the maximum number of assets displayed on the current page, allowing control over the number of items retrieved per request.

TOTAL_ASSETS.description: The total number of assets in the toplist that match the applied filters. This value gives users an overview of the dataset's size.

LIST.description: Contains the sorted and filtered toplist of assets, structured according to the specified criteria (e.g., by ranking metrics or filtering options). This array provides direct access to the asset data matching the userâ€™s query.

TYPE.description: Specifies the type or category of the message or data being handled. This is a unique number / id for each message type.

ID.description: The unique identifier for the asset entry

ID_LEGACY.description: The legacy previous asset management system ID

ID_PARENT_ASSET.description: This refers to the base, parent, or main asset to which a token is linked or pegged, signifying that the token acts as a representation of the parent asset. When a token loses its connection to a parent asset due to events such as hacks or the issuing entity's decision to not honor the pegâ€”similar to how TerraUSD detached from its USD pegâ€”the PARENT_ASSET_SYMBOL is removed because the token no longer serves as a true representation of the parent asset. In order to remove the parent we need clear communication from the company who is in charge of keeping the peg. We add add a plublic notice and the include the communication in the Other Document URLs.

ID_ASSET_ISSUER.description: This field identifies the original creator of the token. It provides essential information about the entity, individual or contract rules responsible for issuing the token initially and/or maintaining the supply. In the case of of bridged assets, this is the bridge operator and the parent will have its own issuer. You can go up the parent chain and figure out what counterparty risk you are exposed to when trading a specific asset. This clarification ensures that users can directly trace the origin of the token, understanding its issuance history and the primary issuer's credentials.

SYMBOL.description: Internal mapped symbol for a specific asset

URI.description: The uri path that this asset will be found on / url-slug

COMMENT.description: Any internal comments you might have for this asset

IS_PUBLIC.description: This is flagged to false when assets are deleted/hidden

ASSIGNED_TO.description: Internal user id of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the asset

ASSIGNED_TO_USERNAME.description: Internal username of the user who is in charge of updating and maintaining the asset at the time of the asset assignment (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

CREATED_ON.description: Asset internal creation unix ts in our system

CREATED_BY.description: Internal user id of the user who created the asset

CREATED_BY_USERNAME.description: Internal username of the user who created the asset at the time of the asset creation (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

UPDATED_ON.description: Asset internal last updated unix ts in our system

UPDATED_BY.description: Internal user id of the user who last updated the asset

UPDATED_BY_USERNAME.description: Internal username of the user who last updated the internal information of the asset at the time of the asset update (the user might have changed their username but not their user id)

PUBLIC_NOTICE.description: A public notice for this asset.

ASSET_STATUS.description: The current operational status of the asset and its underlying project

NAME.description: The full name of the asset, e.g. Bitcoin.

INDEX_MARKET_NAME.description: The internal CoinDesk Indices API market name (index family) for this index.

LOGO_URL.description: The image that appears when you see this asset.

ISO_NUMERIC_CODE.description: The ISO Numeric Code is a unique three-digit numerical identifier assigned to each fiat currency by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO). It is a part of the ISO 4217 standard, which establishes a systematic framework for classifying currencies in international trade and finance. The ISO 4217 standard comprises three components: the alphabetic code, the numeric code, and the minor unit.

ASSET_SYMBOL_GLYPH.description: The Asset Symbol Glyph represents the visual or typographic mark associated with an asset, such as "$" for USD or "â‚¿" for Bitcoin. It is distinct from the asset symbol (e.g., USD, BTC) and provides a recognizable representation used in financial contexts, UIs, and documentation.

LAUNCH_DATE.description: The launch date of the asset is indicated as (yyyy-mm-dd). However, if the asset was initially established as a token before being integrated into a blockchain, the launch date is reset to the creation of the first block when the blockchain is launched for the token.

ASSET_ISSUER_NAME.description: This field identifies the original creator of the asset. It provides essential information about the entity, individual or contract rules responsible for issuing the asset initially and/or maintaining the supply. In the case of of bridged assets, this is the bridge operator and the parent will have its own issuer. You can go up the parent chain and figure out what counterparty risk you are exposed to when trading a specific asset. This clarification ensures that users can directly trace the origin of the asset, understanding its issuance history and the primary issuer's credentials.

PARENT_ASSET_SYMBOL.description: This refers to the base, parent, or main asset to which a token is linked or pegged, signifying that the token acts as a representation of the parent asset. When a token loses its connection to a parent asset due to events such as hacks or the issuing entity's decision to not honor the pegâ€”similar to how TerraUSD detached from its USD pegâ€”the PARENT_ASSET_SYMBOL is removed because the token no longer serves as a true representation of the parent asset. In order to remove the parent we need clear communication from the company who is in charge of keeping the peg. We add add a plublic notice and the include the communication in the Other Document URLs.

RESERVES_BREAKDOWN.description: A detailed breakdown of reserves backing a stablecoin asset, covering various categories such as cash, cryptocurrency, bonds, and other investments for transparency.

RESERVE_TYPE.description: The type of asset used for reserve collateralization, such as cash, crypto, or bonds.

HOLDING_ADDRESSES.description: An array of objects containing the blockchain chain and the holding address (wallet or smart contract) for proof of reserves.

BLOCKCHAIN.description: The blockchain on which the holding address (smart contract or wallet) is located.

ADDRESS.description: The address holding the relevant asset or token, such as a smart contract or wallet. This can be used for proof of reserves.

PERCENTAGE.description: The percentage of the total reserves allocated to this particular reserve type.

DESCRIPTION.description: A brief description for the reserves, clarifying the nature of the reserve type.

COMMENTS.description: Any additional internal comments or information about the reserves.

PREVIOUS_ASSET_SYMBOLS.description: A list of symbols that were previously associated with this asset.

SYMBOL.description: A symbol this asset was previously associated with.

SYMBOL_USAGE_START_DATE.description: Indicates the date this past symbol started being used.

SYMBOL_USAGE_END_DATE.description: Indicates the date this past symbol stopped being used.

DESCRIPTION.description: A description for why this symbol existed or was changed.

HAS_SMART_CONTRACT_CAPABILITIES.description: Can you build smart contracts on top of this?

SMART_CONTRACT_SUPPORT_TYPE.description: This field classifies digital assets based on their level of smart contract support, ranging from assets with no verifiable smart contract capabilities to those offering full autonomy. This categorization helps users and systems understand an asset's technical capacity for smart contract execution, crucial for assessing its utility and potential applications.

IS_EXCLUDED_FROM_PRICE_TOPLIST.description: Indicates whether the asset should be excluded from the overall and asset type price toplist rankings. But this will still be included in the industry ones.

IS_EXCLUDED_FROM_VOLUME_TOPLIST.description: Indicates whether the asset should be excluded from the overall and asset type volume toplist rankings. But this will still be included in the industry ones.

IS_EXCLUDED_FROM_MKT_CAP_TOPLIST.description: Indicates whether the asset should be excluded from the overall and asset type market capitalization toplist rankings. But this will still be included in the industry ones.

MKT_CAP_EXCLUSION_REASON.description: Specifies the reason why the asset is excluded from the market capitalization toplist, aiding in documentation and communication.

IS_USED_IN_DEFI.description: This is used when the sole purpose of the token/blockchain is for it to be used in DeFi. Shows if is a blockchain-based form of finance that does not rely on central financial intermediaries. (DeFi Project).

IS_USED_IN_NFT.description: This is used when the sole purpose of the token/blockchain is for it to be used in NFTs. Is this used in any non-fungible token capacity. Based on this flag we show the nft list.

WEBSITE_URL.description: The link for the official project website.

BLOG_URL.description: The link for the official blog.

WHITE_PAPER_URL.description: A white paper, also written as "whitepaper", a document released by the project that gives investors technical information about its concept, its purpose, how it works, etc.

INDEX_METHODOLOGY.description: This field stores a URL linking to the Index Methodology document, which provides detailed information about the methodology used for constructing an index.

INDEX_FACTSHEET.description: This field stores a URL linking to the Index Factsheet document. The factsheet provides a concise overview of the index, including key metrics, methodology summary, and other relevant information for stakeholders.

INDEX_LINKED_PRODUCTS.description: A structured field representing a list of products linked to a specific index. This includes associated details such as names, symbols or URLs

NAME.description: The primary name or title associated with the entity. This is a general string used to identify the entity uniquely or descriptively.

SYMBOL.description: A shorthand or abbreviated representation of the entity's name, typically used for quick reference or symbolic purposes.

URL.description: A web address or hyperlink associated with the entity. It links to additional resources, references, or detailed information.

COMMENTS.description: A text field for additional notes or commentary about the entity. It supports longer text inputs and is accessible only to users with the "asset_management_viewer" role.

PROSPECTUS.description: This field is designated for uploading the prospectus document of an Exchange-Traded Fund (ETF). The prospectus is a comprehensive report that details the investment's objectives, strategies, risks, and financials. It is essential for investor transparency and regulatory compliance.

OTHER_DOCUMENT_URLS.description: Other documents that might be relevant to the asset, they should all be .PDFs.

PROJECT_LEADERS.description: An array of individuals that contains founders, whitepaper authors, investors, resechers, and other important people related to a project.

ADDRESS.description: The email / linkedin addres / twitter / other social media address

ASSET_INDUSTRIES.description: The asset industries that asset operates in.

JUSTIFICATION.description: A justification for putting an asset in this industry.

ASSET_DYNAMIC_FAQS.description: AI-generated frequently asked questions about the asset, automatically updated based on market conditions and events.

NAME.description: The question or title for this FAQ entry, e.g. "Why is the {asset symbol} price down today?"

LAST_UPDATE_TS.description: The timestamp when this FAQ entry was last generated or updated by AI.

MOVING_24_HOUR_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE.description: The 24 hours percentage percentage change when the asset was news summary was created

TLDR.description: A brief summary with a paragraph and 3 bullet points in markdown format.

TEXT.description: The detailed answer to the FAQ question in markdown format.

SOURCES.description: List of sources used to generate this FAQ entry.

TITLE.description: The title of the article, post, or document

PUBLISHED_ON.description: The timestamp when this the news article refernced was originally published.

LLM_MODEL_NAME.description: The LLM model that generated this FAQ entry (e.g., "openai|gpt-4", "anthropic|3-sonnet")

SCORE.description: AI confidence score - for price movement or positive - negative score for latest news summary:  1 - strongly positive news, 0 strongly negative news for this FAQ entry (0.0 - 1.0)

ASSET_ALTERNATIVE_IDS.description: Alternative data platforms that also support this asset with their specific asset id.

ASSET_DESCRIPTION.description: The long form description in markdown for this asset.

ASSET_DESCRIPTION_SUMMARY.description: The short form description text only for this asset.

ASSET_DESCRIPTION_SNIPPET.description: The shortest form description text only for this asset. This is a lot more limited than the summary. Generally this is a one or maximum two sentences.

CONSENSUS_MECHANISMS.description: The types of consensus mechanisms this network / blockchain / token uses. This is a list of the fault-tolerant mechanism families that are used to achieve the necessary agreement on a single data value or a single state of the network among distributed processes or multi-agent systems.

NAME.description: The type of consensus this blockhain / networks uses.

CONSENSUS_ALGORITHM_TYPES.description: The types of consensus algorithms this blockchain uses. This is dependent on the consensus mechanisms used by the network / blockchain / token. For blockchains that are proof of work this would in most cases have the mining algorithm. For hybrid assets, this would be a list of mining and proof of stake and other algorithm used for reaching consensus.

NAME.description: The name of the algorithm this blockchain uses for the consensus mechanism.

DESCRIPTION.description: A description for the algorithm type.

HASHING_ALGORITHM_TYPES.description: The types of algorithms this blockchain uses for hashing blocks, transactions etc.

NAME.description: The types of algorithms this blockchain uses for hashing blocks, transactions etc.

ASSET_DECIMAL_POINTS.description: The total decimal places this asset can be divided into. E.g. 8 for BTC (1 Satoshi), 18 for ETH (1 Wei). Generally blockchains store all units as integers and this is the number you need to divide the lowest unit of accounting by to get the common unit of measure used for the asset.

SUPPLY_MAX.description: The maximum number of asset parts (coins/tokens) that will ever be issued (supply_circulating + supply_burnt + supply_locked + all supply that has not been issued yet but is planned to be issued in the future). For assets (coins/tokens) that have infinite supply, we use -1.

SUPPLY_ISSUED.description: The number of asset parts (coins/tokens) that have been issued so far. (supply_circulating + supply_locked + supply_burnt)

SUPPLY_TOTAL.description: The number of asset parts (coins/tokens) that have been issued so far excluding burnt tokens. (supply_circulating + supply_locked)

SUPPLY_CIRCULATING.description: Also referred to as free float or public float. The number of asset parts (coins/tokens) that are available to be traded and it excludes burnt supply and locked supply.

SUPPLY_FUTURE.description: The number of asset parts (coins/tokens) that are planned to be issued in the future. (supply_max - supply_issued)

SUPPLY_LOCKED.description: The number of asset parts (coins/tokens) that are currently not transferable until certain conditions are met. Locked supply is generally held by team members, DAOs, foundations, bridges, stakers, liquidity pools, etc.

SUPPLY_BURNT.description: The number of asset parts (coins/tokens) that have been sent to addresses/locations that are no longer accessible. They are permanently removed from the circulating supply on purpose, this does not include lost tokens sent to wallets that do not exist or sent to wallets that users no longer have access to, the address of burnt tokens is determined by the project team.

SUPPLY_STAKED.description: The current number of asset parts (coins/tokens) that are locked as part of PoS and PoS partial chains.

TARGET_BLOCK_MINT.description: New asset parts (coins/tokens) expected to be used to incetivise new block issuance. On tokens / chains that have no underlying asset infation, this will eventually be 0.

TARGET_BLOCK_TIME.description: Target time span in seconds to produce a new block.

LAST_BLOCK_NUMBER.description: The latest block number issued by the network.

LAST_BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.description: The unix timestamp of the most recently issued block.

LAST_BLOCK_TIME.description: Time spent in seconds to produce the most recently issued block.

LAST_BLOCK_SIZE.description: The size in bytes of the most recently issued block.

LAST_BLOCK_ISSUER.description: The miner/validator of the most recently issued block.

LAST_BLOCK_MINT.description: New asset parts (coins/tokens) created in the most recently issued block.

LAST_BLOCK_BURN.description: The total amount of asset parts (coins/tokens) that were taken out of circulation in the most recently issued block.

LAST_BLOCK_TRANSACTION_FEE_TOTAL.description: The sum of all the transaction fees included in the most recently issued block.

LAST_BLOCK_TRANSACTION_COUNT.description: The total number of transactions included in the most recently issued block.

LAST_BLOCK_HASHES_PER_SECOND.description: The total rounds of hashing that are estimated to have been computed in order to produce the most recently issued block. Use -1 for not applicable.

LAST_BLOCK_DIFFICULTY.description: It is a measure of how difficult it was to produce the most recently issued block. Use -1 for not applicable.

MKT_CAP_PENALTY.description: The total penalty applied to the mkt cap due to liquidity or quality of data. Comment example: The value is reduced to 0.01% of the original due to low volume on B+ ranked exchanges or because it is only trading on a limited number of exchanges.

EXPLORER_ADDRESSES.description: The links for the all the blockexplorer websites that support this blockchain.

URL.description: The URL of the block explorer.

RPC_OPERATORS.description: Provides a list of endpoints necessary for accessing RPC data on a specified blockchain network if you prefer not to run your own node.

OPERATOR_NAME.description: The name of the entity responsible for maintaining and providing access to the RPC endpoint.

URL.description: The web address of the RPC endpoint, where requests can be sent to interact with the blockchain.

REQUIRES_API_KEY.description: The parameter name to be used for passing the API key in requests to the RPC endpoint.

DOCUMENTATION_URL.description: The web address where the documentation for the RPC endpoint can be found. This documentation provides details on how to interact with the blockchain via the endpoint, including available methods, parameters, and examples.

API_KEY_PARAMETER_NAME.description: Specifies the location (e.g., header, query parameter) where the API key should be included in the request.

API_KEY_PARAMETER_LOCATION.description: Specifies the part of the HTTP request where the API key should be included. This can vary based on the endpoint requirements, such as including the key in the URL path, query parameters, POST parameters, or HTTP headers.

BURN_ADDRESSES.description: The list of addresses that are considered burn addresses for this asset.

NAME.description: The name of the address. Contract name or just the common name for this address.

BLOCKCHAIN.description: The is linked to the asset representing a specific chain.

ADDRESS.description: The address of the smart contracts, external user accounts or other account

DESCRIPTION.description: A description for the address.

LOCKED_ADDRESSES.description: The list of addresses that are considered locked addresses for this asset.

NAME.description: The name of the address. Contract name or just the common name for this address.

BLOCKCHAIN.description: The is linked to the asset representing a specific chain.

ADDRESS.description: The address of the smart contracts, external user accounts or other account

DESCRIPTION.description: A description for the address.

CONTROLLED_ADDRESSES.description: The list of designated addresses used to manage and store assets within an investment portfolio or on behalf of clients. This includes addresses where cryptocurrencies, securities, or other assets are held, reflecting the diverse nature of modern investment strategies. It encompasses addresses used by exchanges, ETFs, and companies to maintain their investment reserves or operational funds.

BLOCKCHAIN.description: The is linked to the asset representing a specific chain.

ADDRESS.description: The address of the smart contracts, external user accounts or other account

ADDRESS_PURPOSE.description: The role of the address within the company's operations, aiding in precise asset management and regulatory compliance. This categorization distinguishes between addresses for investments, client custody, and operational expenses, streamlining asset control and reporting.

CONTROL_TYPE.description: Classifies the level and nature of control the company exercises over various cryptocurrency addresses. This categorization helps delineate the operational and security protocols associated with each address, ranging from single-key direct control to multi-signatory arrangements and even non-control strategies.

NAME.description: The name of the address. Contract name or just the common name for this address.

DESCRIPTION.description: A description for the address to help people understand better what it is for.

SUPPORTED_STANDARDS.description: The supported standards that tokens on this blockchain operate in. For blockchains that support smart contracts, supported standards are often included to tell people how to create, issue, deploy and interact with tokens based on the underlying blockchain.

NAME.description: One of the token standards supported/available on this blockchain.

SUPPORTED_PLATFORMS.description: When an asset (token, fiat, cryptocurrency, commodity) can be used on multiple blockchains, we refer to those blockchains as supported platforms. There are two types of assets that can be used on multiple blockchains: native tokens and bridged tokens. Native tokens are assets that are natively supported by a particular blockchain, while bridged tokens are assets that are "bridged" or "pegged" to another asset on a different blockchain.

BLOCKCHAIN.description: This is linked to the asset representing a specific chain.

BLOCKCHAIN_ASSET_ID.description: This is linked to the asset ID representing a specific chain.

TOKEN_STANDARD.description: This is linked to the Blockchain field and it is one of the SUPPORTED_STANDARDS available on that platform.

EXPLORER_URL.description: The URL for the token explorer website or tool.

SMART_CONTRACT_ADDRESS.description: Unique identifier of the asset on the given blockchain (e.g., smart contract address for EVMs and chains that work with smart contracts, asset ID for Omni, symbol or symbol hex.issuer for XRP); format varies by chain.

LAUNCH_DATE.description: The data the smart contract on the supported platform was deployed or when the token was added.

RETIRE_DATE.description: The date the smart contract on the supported platform was retired or the token was deleted.

TRADING_AS.description: The symbol/ticker this asset trades under on the specific blockchain platform.

DECIMALS.description: The number of decimal points on the specific blockchain platform for this token.

IS_INHERITED.description: This is flagged to true if it comes from one of the assets that has this asset as a parent

LAYER_TWO_SOLUTIONS.description: Available layer two scaling solutions and their associated data for this blockchain.

PERMISSIONED_ADDRESSES.description: Special addresses of smart contracts, external user accounts or other accounts that have special rights to modify state on the smart contracts for this layer two solution.

ADDRESS.description: The address of the smart contracts, external user accounts or other account

DESCRIPTION.description: A description for the account.

SMART_CONTRACTS_INVOLVED.description: Special addresses of smart contracts that are involved in the L2 scaling solution.

IS_UPGRADABLE.description: Tick this box if the smart contract is upgradable

DESCRIPTION.description: A description for the smart contract.

NAME.description: The name of privacy solution feature

PRIVACY_SOLUTION_TYPE.description: The Privacy Solution Type field indicates whether the privacy-enhancing features for transactions are integrated directly into the blockchain protocol or if they require the use of external tools or services.

SEO_TITLE.description: The title that appears when you post this page on social media.

SEO_DESCRIPTION.description: The description that appears when you post this page on social media.

OPEN_GRAPH_IMAGE_URL.description: The image that appears when you share the asset on social media, if not available we use the logo_url.

ASSET_DESCRIPTION_EXTENDED_SEO.description: The long form description in markdown for this asset that has been reviewed or hand crafted by a person with SEO expertise to have the higest impact in rankings.

CODE_REPOSITORIES.description: The open source code repositories where the code for this blockchain / token is.

URL.description: The URL of the code repository.

MAKE_3RD_PARTY_REQUEST.description: This is used by our content editors to disable endpoints when needed.

OPEN_ISSUES.description: The number of open issues in the code repository. An open issue is a reported problem, suggestion, or task related to a repository that has not been resolved or closed yet, providing a platform for users to track and discuss the ongoing development and improvements of a project.

CLOSED_ISSUES.description: The number of closed issues in the code repository. A closed issue is a reported problem, suggestion, or task related to a repository that have been resolved or deemed no longer relevant, providing a record of past challenges and solutions within the project development.

OPEN_PULL_REQUESTS.description: The number of open pull requests in the code repository. An open pull request on GitHub is a proposed change to a repository's codebase that is open for review and discussion, offering contributors an opportunity to improve the project and maintainers to accept, reject, or request changes before integrating the proposed modifications.

CLOSED_PULL_REQUESTS.description: The number of closed pull requests in the code repository. A closed pull request is a proposed change to a repository's codebase that has been either accepted and merged into the codebase, rejected by the maintainers, or withdrawn by the submitter, providing a record of changes that were suggested and their outcomes in the project's development history.

CONTRIBUTORS.description: The number of contributors in the code repository. A contributor is a users who has contributed to a project by making changes or improvements to the project's codebase, having their changes accepted and merged, and is acknowledged for their contributions in the project's development history.

FORKS.description: The number of forks of this code repository. A fork in GitHub is a feature that allows users to create a personal copy of another repository, enabling them to modify, experiment with, or contribute to the project without affecting the original work.

STARS.description: The number of stars in the code repository. A star is when a GitHub user bookmarks or wants to show appreciation for a particular repository, much like a "like" or "favorite" function on other social media platforms.

SUBSCRIBERS.description: The number of subscribers to the code repository. A subscriber is a user who has chosen to receive notifications for updates or changes made to a specific repository, allowing them to closely follow the development and discussions of a project.

LAST_UPDATED_TS.description: The timestamp we last tried to get data for this code repository.

CREATED_AT.description: The timestamp the code repository was created.

UPDATED_AT.description: The timestamp of the last changes that occured in the code repository.

LAST_PUSH_TS.description: The timestamp of the last commit to the code repository.

CODE_SIZE_IN_BYTES.description: The total size of this code repository in bytes.

IS_FORK.description: Is this repository a fork of another code repository.

LANGUAGE.description: The primary programming language of the code repository.

FORKED_ASSET_DATA.description: The asset this repository is forked from

ID.description: The unique identifier for the asset

SYMBOL.description: Internal mapped symbol for a specific asset

CODE_REPOSITORY_URL.description: The URL of the asset's code repository.

ENDPOINTS_USED.description: List of endpoints used for retrieving code repository data.

URL.description: The URL of the code repository endpoint that was called.

TYPE.description: The type of the code repository endpoint that was called.

LAST_CALL.description: The timestamp of the last call made to the code repository endpoint.

LAST_CALL_SUCCESS.description: The timestamp of the last successful call made to the code repository endpoint.

EXTERNAL_CACHE_KEY.description: The External Cache key (E-Tag) is a header that provides a mechanism for web caches and clients to validate cached resources, this is used for determining if a request has change since it's last call

CURRENT_ACTIVE_USERS.description: The number of currently active users in the subreddit.

AVERAGE_POSTS_PER_DAY.description: The computed daily average number of posts within a specific subreddit. This figure is determined by examining the most recent 100 posts within the subreddit and utilizing their frequency to extrapolate an average daily post count.

AVERAGE_POSTS_PER_HOUR.description: The computed hourly average number of posts within a specific subreddit. This figure is determined by examining the most recent 100 posts within the subreddit and utilizing their frequency to extrapolate an average hourly post count.

AVERAGE_COMMENTS_PER_DAY.description: The computed daily average number of comments within a specific subreddit. This figure is determined by examining the most recent 100 comments within the subreddit and utilizing their frequency to extrapolate an average daily comment count.

AVERAGE_COMMENTS_PER_HOUR.description: The computed hourly average number of comments within a specific subreddit. This figure is determined by examining the most recent 100 comments within the subreddit and utilizing their frequency to extrapolate an average hourly comment count.

SUBSCRIBERS.description: The number of subscribers to the subreddit.

COMMUNITY_CREATED_AT.description: The timestamp when the subreddit community was created.

LAST_UPDATED_TS.description: The timestamp of the last update to the subreddit.

HELD_TOKEN_SALE.description: Use this flag to get access to all the token sale fields.

TOKEN_SALE_DATE_START.description: The date and time the ICO will start at. Time is in GMT.

TOKEN_SALE_DATE_END.description: The date the token sale will end at. Time is in GMT.

TOKEN_SALE_DESCRIPTION.description: A brief description about the basic aspects of the token sale.

TOKEN_SALE_TEAM_MEMBERS.description: The team members that are working on the project

ADDRESS.description: The email / linkedin addres / twitter / other social media address

TOKEN_SALE_WEBSITE_URL.description: The link of the ICO page.

TOKEN_SALE_SUPPLY.description: Total number of tokens available to investors for the token sale. This does not include the reserve. It is just the sum of all the TOKEN_SALE_RESERVE_SPLIT.

TOKEN_SALE_RESERVE_SUPPLY.description: Total number of tokens kept in reserve or allocated to team mebers. This does not include the tokens sold to investors. It is just the sum of all the TOKEN_SALE_RESERVE_SPLIT.

TOKEN_SALE_SUPPLY_ADDED.description: Total number of tokens added in this token sale. This is equal to TOKEN_SALE_SUPPLY + TOKEN_SALE_RESERVE_SUPPLY.

TOKEN_SALE_PRE_SALE_SUPPLY.description: Total number of tokens available before this this token sale. This is the sum of all the previous sales, on the first token sale this will be 0. TOKEN_SALE_POST_SALE_SUPPLY  = TOKEN_SALE_PRE_SALE_SUPPLY + TOKEN_SALE_SUPPLY_ADDED.

TOKEN_SUPPLY_POST_SALE.description: The numbers of tokens post Sale. This should be all the locked tokens, the team tokens and all other tokens not included in the sale. It should be equal to TOKEN_SALE_RESERVE + TOKEN_SALE_SUPPLY.

TOKEN_SALE_PAYMENT_METHOD_TYPE.description: The payment method for the token sale. The currencies that are accepted in this token sale.

TOKEN_SALE_START_PRICE.description: The start price of the token sale.

TOKEN_SALE_START_PRICE_CURRENCY.description: The currency of the start price.

TOKEN_SALE_FUNDING_CAP.description: Hard cap refers to the maximum number of tokens that can be sold, is the maximum amount of funds the development team is willing to collect to move forward with project.

TOKEN_SALE_FUNDING_CAP_CURRENCY.description: This is the maximum amount of funds the development team is willing to collect to move forward with project.

TOKEN_SALE_FUNDING_TARGET.description: If the token sale is unable to raise this amount, it may be cancelled and the collected funds returned to the participants.

TOKEN_SALE_FUNDING_TARGET_CURRENCY.description: If the token sale is unable to raise this amount, it may be cancelled and the collected funds returned to the participants.

TOKEN_SALE_FUNDS_RAISED.description: The total funds that the project raised in the token sale (tokens sold).

TOKEN_SALE_FUNDS_RAISED_USD.description: Total $ raised in this token sale.

TOKEN_SALE_INVESTORS_SPLIT.description: The way the tokens that are sold are split

TOKEN_SALE_RESERVE_SPLIT.description: The way the tokens that are not sold are split. The token sale TOKEN_SALE_RESERVE total should be the sum of all the TOKEN_SALE_RESERVE_SPLITs. Sum of TOKEN_SALE_RESERVE_SPLIT and TOKEN_SALE_SUPPLY  should be equal to TOKEN_SUPPLY_POST_SALE.

ADDRESS.description: The address where these tokens as kept

DESCRIPTION.description: A description for how they intend to use the funds.

TOKEN_SALE_NOTABLE_INVESTORS.description: The notable investors in the token sale

EQUITY_SALE_ENTITY_URL.description: The link of the equity sale page.

EQUITY_SALE_SUPPLY.description: Total number of shares available for the equity sale.

TOTAL_EQUITY_SUPPLY_POST_RAISE.description: Total number of shares the company has issued including the shares in this equity sale.

EQUITY_SALE_FUNDING_TARGET.description: If the equity sale is unable to raise this amount, it may be cancelled and the collected funds returned to the participants.

EQUITY_SALE_LEGAL_ADVISERS.description: The lawyers that are advising the company on the equity sale structure.
